Reviews.Title: “Comfort in confortel”
Reviews.Author: xar126
Reviews.Content: Take comfort in this 3 star hotel not exactly in the middle of things. There is not much going around the neighborhood cause it takes a few blocks to get to places from here to the bus terminal or to the tram as well as the closest and main attraction of barcelona sagrada familia. But if your the kind who likes To be tucked away from the bustle of a touristic area, this might be a place for you. The place is modern at least has a big elevator than most European hotel I've been to. The breakfast in the morning has good choices than the most average hotel. The room Needs some soundproofing cause I can hear the door slam as someone gets in and out of an adjacent room. The hand railing in the toilet was about to come off but the toilet is clean with good smelling towels with an efficient water heating system. The room is cozy but dust is noticeable when you fluff the comforter. The customize chairs is small and uncomfortable unless your a midget. Overall my stay was average and pleasant meet its 3 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore from. Clean and simple with free WiFi.”
Reviews.Author: tiggyBirmingham
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quite a bit cheaper than others I'd looked at but the reviews were generally good. We made our way by train and Metro from the airport and did not have a problem finding it. Location was great for us and despite buying a T10 travel ticket at the airport we spent the whole week walking. The hotel is close to the Arc de Triomf metro station but far enough away from La Ramblas to get a good night's sleep. A review I read suggested making sure you got an outside facing room, they were right. It wasn't too hot while we were there so I kept the window shut, but when I did open it you could hear the conversations of everyone in rooms facing the enclosed mini plaza. I can imagine that being awful in a busy summer week. We didn't opt for breakfast in house and was glad as there are so many cafes and an indoor market just round the corner to choose from with better value for money. I always take my travel kettle away for morning tea & coffee. The fridge in the room was a great touch along with a fresh stock of free bottled water every day, excellent! Staff spoke perfect English and were very polite and helpful. The pool wasn't open as it was too early in the season but you could still sit on the roof terrace. The gym was small but perfectly adequate, although we didn't use it as we walked so much we only used the hotel to wash and sleep. The bathroom could have done with a a bit of sprucing up if you're bothered about aesthetics but everything functioned properly and the shower was hot with very good pressure. Had an excellent holiday would go to the same hotel again very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and adequate”
Reviews.Author: Steve W
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, good location. People at front desk are friendly. Small, but it works for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable three star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joe R
Reviews.Content: Smooth stay with generally pleasant staff on hand at reception. Some issues with the language barrier - one did not speak English and hence was rather abrupt with us. However, everything we needed was provided. Breakfast was adequate but not worth paying for on a daily basis when one can just go out to a local cafe. Major gripes were that there was nothing warm available apart from toast and the selection was a little lacking. However, it did turn out to be free despite booking via Hotwire which was a pleasant surprise and it would have been nice if we were informed of this before. The room was adequate. Clean, simple decor and the complimentary water bottles came in use. View to the back of the building was disappointing but then again the view out of the front wouldn't have been much better. The area that the hotel is located within is not exactly central but it is an easy enough walk to the Sagrada Família (Barcelona Basilica) in order to pick up tourist buses or walk down to the beach. There is a swimming pool on the roof of the hotel which although we did not get a chance to use we would warn others it is extremely small. Overall, a decent stay and what should be expected from a three star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service, good location overall great value for money”
Reviews.Author: alexandra_alicia
Reviews.Content: The staff were really helpful and all spoke excellent English. The room was clean and they provided free bottles of water, a nice touch. The room didn't have a desk or dressing table which was slightly annoying for doing make up, but hardly a major concern. The location is good, not in the middle of everything about a 20 mins walk to Barcelonetta beach and 25 mins to Sagrada Famillia, but close enough that you can walk or take the metro to everywhere easily. It was worth staying a little further out and having a nice hotel. Overall excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Sayda B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Confortel during our recent European trip. We were quite pleased with our stay. The hotel is situated about 8 to 10 blocks from Las Ramblas and the Gothic area, it is about 7 blocks away from the Sagrada Familia church, and it was 6 blocks away from the train station by the Arc. Overall the location was pretty good. We walked and took the metro trains throughout the city. It is a 30 to 35 euro cab ride from the airport (if you've packed light, I recommend walking to Plaza Catalunya where there are shuttles to the airport for a fraction of the cab cost I paid - we packed heavy so it would be quite a walk). The rooms were spacious, the wifi was a bit weak but we managed, the rooms were clean and well maintained, and the hotel staff were very helpful and spoke good english. The hotel was well priced (I stayed during non-peak times). I also felt it was pretty safe. The hotel has a modern look to it but it doesn't really stand out when you look at it from the out side. All in all I was pleased with my stay and I felt I got more for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean... Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Mike1227
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel using Hotwire's price deals without knowing the name before hand. When I saw the location and price deal I recieved ($1 less total for the two night booking! And the price dropped $20 and Hotwire refused to give me the price match guarantee) , I was Not happy at all with this hotel. After researching and reading up, I settled down and realized the hotel could work well for the trip. LOCATION: 3.5 When arriving, the hotel is in a descent area, but not touristy. It was very easy to get to and from the Arc de Triumf metro station. I enjoy walking the cities I visit, and to get to Las Ramblas or Barceloneta beaches, it is a good 15-20 minute walk. The Arc de Triumf and The Parc situated directly south of it were extremely populated and busy on Saturday afternoon. Made for a good stroll to watch rollerbladers, capoeira dancers, etc. I was hoping to be in a different location, but overall the location was not bad at all. TIP- Bracafe is right around the corner from the hotel. Great food and service, very cheap price. Ate breakfast there twice and had lunch one day. HOTEL- 4 The hotel is very modern and minimalistic. There is a nice bar area for breakfast (didn't use personally) and a few couches to relax. The rooms had a nice decor, but nothing useless inside. The bathroom was a descent size, with very cool anti-fog mirrors. The bed was comfortable and had a few extra pillows in the closets. And the free water, which I made fun of before getting to the hotel, turned out to be great for the day walks. The only problem with our room was that the heater/ac did not work at all. It made the room tough to sleep in both nights. Service- 3 It started off average since I emailed the hotel asking for the easiest directions to the hotel from the airport. Their website gives a driving route, but not specific buses, metros, etc. (46 bus to Playa espanya, then L1 to Arc de Triumf). The hotel never emailed back. The staff spoke fluent english, and it was easy to check-in/out. They gave us the choice of smoking or non-smoking rooms. They always greeted us when we entered the hotel. The only gripe was the AC problem. After the first night, I spoke to the front desk attendant and explained that the AC source was not working at all. It did not turn on/off and that we would be out all day if someone could look at it and fix it for us. When we returned that evening, there was no mention of the results. No note or message to explain to us, and no offer to change rooms. As it was already very late, we decided to not to bother with changing rooms. Overall- 3.5 As I said, I did not personally choose this hotel. But I was happy with the results of our stay. It was a good value $100 a night USD. I would recommend this hotel for people wanting to stay away from the full on tourist mayhem of Las Ramblas area, and for those trying to save a bit. I would stay again if the value was right even though I prefer the Poble-sec area much better.

Reviews.Title: “Confortel Auditori”
Reviews.Author: Themaadone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in February 2012 for 3 nights. The hotel is unassuming from the outside with good local amenities. There is a good, modern, clean and friendly cerveseria opposite the hotel, some fast food eateries nearby, several supermarkets and a Metro station 8 Minutes walk away near the Arc de Tromfe. The entrance/ foyer to the hotel is clean and friendly, your eye gets taken to the reception and is easy to spot with attentive staff who checked us in with no problems. At the same time they gave us a small map of Barcelona and the WIFI code which comes in handy and cuts roaming costs. There are 2 lifts next to the reception which are also clean and usually quick to come after being requested. Downstairs from the reception are the management offices, the small Gym and toilets. It smelt a little of toilet/sewage there but the cleaners were alsways about cleaning! Beware the toilet lights run on motion timers - if you like meditating and taking your time over a leisurly number 2 the light will pop off and plunge you into perpetual darkness.... The room we had allocated was very good. Clean walls, floors and bedding. A decent, firm bed, fair sized bathroom, flatscreen TV and good lights. Ample space to hang clothes, a mini fridge with 4 free bottles of water which was restocked when room was cleaned. The safe is also free of charge unlike some hotels. The bathroom had a walk in shower and was powerful and hot (a little too hot at first but then that's my fault for turning it to full without checking). We did have to ask for a repair to the shower unit due to the holder being cracked meaning you had to hold the shower to have a shower. It was fixed within 12 hours of mentioning this to the reception staff. The room was very good in my opinion even though our view was the inner courtyard with little natural light but we went to see Barcelona and not the courtyard! We did not have breakfast at the hotel - at between 9-13 euros it was far more expensive than outside the hotel and we did not try the hotel bar either. At check out the hotel ordered a taxi which arrived promptly and they looked after our bags so we could enjoy our last day. Top marks for service! A special note of thanks to the reception staff. All are attentive, polite and helpful especially Dean who acted swiftly and with an asserted politness which was nice to see in hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, good location, recommended.”
Reviews.Author: icsh
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I staid in this hotel for 5 night at the end of the Jan. We have really enjoyed. I got a really good price for 5 nights without breakfast. However, you can find so many bakeries and shops where you can get a good breakfast. Neighborliness was nice and relatively quiet. Metro station " Arc de Triomf " 5 minutes or less walk. Near metro station was a wonderful bakery. All kind of bread and pastries, plus good coffee ( much cheaper then cafe next door), great for breakfast. Hotel was very clean, personal very friendly. Room was a good size and clean, bed was comfortable. Free wi-fi ( you need to ask for password at the front desk), 4 bottles of water every day. If I would ever go to Barcelona, I would certainly come back and stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: captevan
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with very logical prices. We paid 350€ for a double room without breakfast for 6 nights! There is no need to buy breakfast in Barcelona. Every corner has a small shop where you can buy a sandwich or anything you like and its not worth paying an additional 12-16€ per person for any hotel's breakfast. It' clean, it has free internet access (you must ask for the password at the reception) and it's best value for money. It is located near Arc de Triomf metro station (7' walk) and near the bus station (4' walk). We booked it through booking.com.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location!”
Reviews.Author: Matt K
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our four night stay here. A really good deal on Expedia made this place quite a good value. The hotel was clean and the beds were comfortable. The free wifi and 4 bottles of water per day were also nice. We also liked that we could walk to quite a few sites and the metro as well. I can't add much more than than what other positive reviewers here have already said. I would certainly come back here on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and average location, but could do better”
Reviews.Author: itsafrogslife
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here during a cheap weekend break in January. We got a really good price on the hotel and flight with it being the off season straight after Christmas and New Year. The hotel is situated within walking distance of four different Metro stations, including Arc de Triomf, and isn't too far from Las Ramblas and Pl Catalunya. On checking in we asked for a quiet room, only to find we'd been given one opposite the lift. In this room the electronic safe didn't work, and when we tried to call reception the phone wasn't working either. When we went back down, the receptionist tried to make out that it was hard for him to find another suitable room that was free, but he eventually gave us one right at the end of a corridor - nice and quiet! Unfortunately this room wasn't without a problem either, and when it was a little chilly on the second night we found that the heating wasn't working as the control unit on the wall was broken. As you can see from the photos (and probably from the room problems) this hotel suffers from the same problem that many of the better hotels do - it was really nice when it was first opened (or last refurbished) but is now starting to fray a little at the edges. On the plus side, however, the room was clean and a good size. And apart from the heating problem (a t-shirt solved it in the end) the quality of sleep was good. There's complimentary wi-fi and bottled water too.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, ok location”
Reviews.Author: xlaurzx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during our stay in Barcelona. The prices were resonably cheap considering however the location was a bit far from the city. I booked this hotel mainly for the closeness of it being to the bus station as we got the Barcelona bus from Girona Airport. However the good points were that it was clean, good size and the bed was quite comfortable! Also you got 4 bottles of water compimentary every day which was great and free wifi internet which worked perfectly! The negative was the location as it was a 30 min walk to the Ramblas, however its only a 10 min walk to the Sagrada Familie which was awesome! The staff were helpful, we didnt get breakfast as we just got some fruit and crossants from the local shop down the road. Also if you wanted to eat, avoid going near the La Rambla and stay closer to the hotel as we got a beer of Estrella Damn for only $1.70 each and in La Rambla was a whopping $6! However, Barcelona is a beautiful city and would recommend this hotel if you want to stay close to the Sagrada Familie and bus station, Barcelona Nord.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, great location”
Reviews.Author: DummyBoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 5 nights. The room price was not cheap (~140EUR/night for a triple room) but in the price range for this part of Barcelona. The room was clean and beds were made every day. Despite small glitches in the bathroom, it was ok. We had 4 bottles of water per day. This was useful as the tap water had some bad aftertaste The traject to the airport cost about 35EUR (depending on the number of persons & pieces of bagage). The room we had was quiet despite being located streetside. There was some airconditioned which we had to use as the room was really warm otherwise (and it was in November) You are within walking distance of la Sagrada Familia (~15min) and the Arc de Triumf metro station is reachable within a 10min walk. Breakfasts were somewhat expensive (~15EUR) but you can have it in a small bar/café for a couple euros [there is a Bracafe close to the bus station - cheap and tasty breakfast and tapas] There is also a small grocery not very far opened till about midnight if you need a little snack

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Azurian
Reviews.Content: We paid £44 a night through Expedia for a 4 night stay. The staff were friendly and helpful, Dean especially so. The room was an OK size and very clean. Breakfast was very expensive at 13 Euros a night each, so we walked down to the nearby Bus Station for Coffee and croissant at 2 Euros. Although not central it took us 20 minutes to stroll to Las Ramblas and about the same to Sagrada Familia ;a five minute walk to the Metro station at Arc de Triomf is only a couple of stops away from Placa Catalunya. Plenty of bars in the area for Tapas on drinks etc. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Only one weird thing....”
Reviews.Author: BrEuCkLeN
Reviews.Content: My cousin & I stayed here before embarking on our Medierranean cruise. I read the reviews & decided to roll the dice. Not knowing what to expect I must say we were pleasantly surprised. I wouldn't say it's a 4 star hotel, but (for this site)out of 5 it can get 4 rating from me. First let me say GREAT PRICE! We got there early & were allowed to check in at no extra charge. The front desk staff spoke english so we didn't have to stumble through our limited spanish. The moderately sized room was clean, the safe working, water in the fridge, wi-fi working & when we had an issue with our TV it was resolved in minutes! We just needed someplace safe to put our bags down, take a hot shower & dress to go out so this was well suited for us. Yes there is something different about the shower door set up, I noticed it at another hotel too, be careful not to wet up the floor. Coming from NYC I found things to be close enough to get to whether you wanted a nice walk, or a short cab ride(we never even looked for the subway). If you explore well enough you can find great restaurants, souvenir shops & there's even a bus station up the block that has cheap internet in case you didn't bring your laptop,tablet, etc... Barcelona is a beautiful city with romance & history. The ever popular Plaza Catalunya & La Rambla is a way off but not so far that you can't get there in 15 minutes. La Sagrada Familia & Arc de Triomf, which are legendary, are 5 minutes away(in opposite directions). Only one weird thing... I forgot to post my postcards at the post office. The front desk was happy to send them off for me at the rate of 1 Euro per card but here it is THREE weeks later & no one has gotten them. Things that make you say hmmm....

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: Shez S
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights. The location is okay but not that great, nearest metro station is a 7 minute walk from the hotel but it just two stops away from Plaza Catalunya which is where you want to be in Barcelona. When we checked in the room wasn't ready yet so we had to wait for about half an hour. The reception staff aren't particularly friendly but they do their job. The rooms are smaller than expected from the pictures but they are clean (a bit on the sterile side) and provide good soundproofing from outside. We booked a double bed but were provided two twin beds put together. We didn't mind it at the start but quickly found that they separate easily (beds are light) and leave a gap in between which is very uncomfortable. There is no suitcase holder so we had to use the desk chair for that. As with all the other hotels in Spain we stayed in, the only English language channels are BBC and CNN. Wi-Fi internet is provided and works satisfactorily. Bathroom is small but adequate. Breakfast is okay - no hot food except for a toaster. Lots of pastries which we found very unusual for breakfast. Overall not a bad hotel for the price but I wouldn't go stay there again because of the location .

Reviews.Title: “Modern & clean hotel - good location...”
Reviews.Author: GerMc615
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights for our short break to Barcelona and found this hotel very nice. We found this a very modern hotel, very clean and pretty good location. We took a taxi to the hotel from airport (€40 for the fare, but it was very late when we arrived in the city and preferred not to take our chances with the airport bus to the city centre that late at night). The hotel is within a 5-10 minute walk to the Arc de Triump (you can get the metro to the city centre here), 15-20 minute walk to Las Ramblas (approximately €15 by taxi) and €6 taxi to Port Olimpic! We didn’t rely on the staff too much, as we did much research for this trip before we arrived. However the staff did help us when we needed them, we booked our tickets for the FC Barcelona match through the hotel and also arranged a taxi for us at 5.30 a.m. when we were checking out. You can also purchase tickets for excursions there and book tickets for the sight seeing bus (there are actually 2different city sight seeing tours - we didn’t use the company that the hotel advertises). The use of free internet was also great as we were able to check things out for ourselves! We didn’t eat at the restaurant but in the mornings we went across the street to get coffee from the bar and next door to the bar was a bakery. We would then bring our coffee and pastries back to the room and eat before we left for the day. The only problem we incurred while we were staying there was that the electricity was out one morning. I'm not sure if this was a problem within the hotel or was it the area, however it was back up and running in no time and didn’t really cause too much of an inconvenience. Sometimes these things can’t be helped. The rooms were not the biggest I've ever stayed in, but for a sightseeing trip around Barcelona, it wasn't our intention to spend that much time in the room (the pictures of the room are very accurate). The rooms were very clean and modern and there was a mini fridge which had bottled water in it (which you weren't charged for – a rarity these days). One day we did come back to the hotel and you could smell cleaning materials, but it wasn’t too strong just had that "just cleaned smell" in the room, which to us meant someone actually cleaned the room and not just made the bed. There were also 2safes in the room - one for your belongings and another one big enough to put your laptop into as well. The beds were very comfy with 2 spare pillows. The double bed was 2 single beds put together, but this isn’t very uncommon in European hotels. And the A/C was a plus as we found the weather very humid for the end of October. Even though you could fully open the window, we were in an internal room and there wasn't too much air circulating into the room. All in all it was a very nice hotel and we had a very enjoyable time in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel - perhaps a two star”
Reviews.Author: sylvia547
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. It is shown on line as a 4 star hotel. It is maybe a two star. Disinterested desk clerks, no baggage handlers, the elevator did not work so everyone was forced to drag their own luggage up and down the stairs. The desk clerk said that she didn't have any help and that everyone was on their own concerning their luggage. The room was amazingly small. There was mold in all of the cracks in the bathroom tiles. If you are sensitive to smells beware. I felt as though I was getting chemical poisoning from the cleaning materials used by the maids in the rooms. Sure it is in a good location, but so are several dozen other hotels in the immediate location. It was not a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel nice location”
Reviews.Author: IsraelAndreyka
Reviews.Content: The room are well maintained and clean. The roof pool is really small. Pretty close to the Arc de triumf subway station and about 10-15 min walk to city center. We god the internal room without any view.

Reviews.Title: “great for city strollers”
Reviews.Author: LooovesToTravel
Reviews.Content: great hotel! Nice, clean and modern rooms! It offers a good size of the rooms, too. Windows were openable! Which is not always the occasion in Barcelona. The pool and the fitness-area is absolutly o.k.! The hotel is 5 min walking distance to Arch of Triumph, hence, great for city strollers!!!! Plus, the bathroom is actually seperated through a door from the rest of the hotel room (which, again, is not a give fact in Barcelona). I for once believe that is quite nice to have a propper door and not only a nice looking/fancy glass door.

Reviews.Title: “Overall "very good"”
Reviews.Author: Abdulazizhj
Reviews.Content: This is not a 5 star hotel, but their services are very good. The rooms are a little bit small, but not bad. The staff are very helpful. Didn't try their kitchen. The location is very nice. The neighborhood is quite and clean. The attractions are about 2 km away (sagrada familia, rambla street, port olimpic…etc). In addition, the subway station "arc de triamf" is very close. So, my overall review is this hotel is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and Small Hotel with no amenities... never go back...”
Reviews.Author: _wanderer_2727
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very much handy in location (around 2 km to city center). That's the best part. The rest is complain: very small rooms, tiny lobby, 150 x 150 cm sized roof pool, very expensive breakfast, no bellboy, no room service, nobody around usually. This place is just a sleep-in. That'a an AWFUL mischevious presentation of amenities by EXPEDiA.COM and I will never buy anything from expedia.com again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous trip. Hotel good and bad but would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Elisabetta W
Reviews.Content: Contrary to previous reviews the location of this hotel was only a 15 minute walk from Catalunya which was totally manageable and quite enjoyable. The pool was tiny but it is so unusual to get some sun bathing space in a city centre hotel that I feel it was still a valuable addition. The hotel itself was smart and clean except parts of the bathroom could have done with a bit of an overhaul. My main concern was that the hotel did not have an iron to loan out to guests. Given that the hotel claims to cater for the business and leisure communities I felt this was a massive oversight that I feel they should address. Staff were friendly and helpful and spoke good English if necessary and I feel I would stay there again if I got a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: SoCalNative7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Barcelona. The hotel is a good size and keeps the reception desk open around-the-clock--which was lucky for us, as our train was delayed and we didn't arrive until 2am. Other hotels wouldn't have been staffed, leaving us with no room! The service at the desk was friendly and helpful. The room was quite large, by European standards, and modern and well appointed. The AC worked great (which you can't always count on in Europe...) and the room was quiet, save for the family next door who consistently slammed their door many times in the mornings. (Not sure what was going on there...family feud, perhaps?) The location is good, roughly 10 minutes from the amazing Sagrada Familia (and the Bus Touristic stop nearby) and about 7 minutes from the nearest subway stop. It's a 10-15 minute cab from the train station. It's a bit further from the Gothic Quarter and Las Ramblas than many other hotels, but we appreciated getting away from the main tourist areas. All in all, a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring but be prepared to walk plenty!”
Reviews.Author: kerrl6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights and found it to be a good base, if a little bit too far out of the way of the busiest areas of the city. This was no bad thing given that we were happy to be staying well away from Las Ramblas! The hotel is quite modern and clean with a handy cold fridge in the room for keeping fruit and drinks cool! The staff were good but the language issue was a bit of a problem, especially as we had issues with the safe in our room (it didn't work in the first room-they moved us at our request as we wanted a working safe, i set it incorrectly in the second room and we had to wait for 2 days for it to be fixed! Having to leave our valuables in the safe at reception so lots of comings and goings which was a little inconvenient). Breakfast wasn't included in our stay but this was fine as we preferred to buy fresh fruit and pastries from one of the local shops and eat breakfast al-fresco in the park which is only a few minutes walk away through a lovely open space in front of the Arc de Triomphe! We spent lots of time in this area actually, it was lovely to sit and watch the world go by or for a late evening stroll. The roof top pool was our main reason for choosing this hotel but we never got into it! It was so small that if there was already a person or two in the pool you felt as if you were intruding! We tried several times but didn't bother in the end! We walked pretty much everywhere from the hotel-the marina and beach, the Sagrada Familia, Las Ramblas, the zoo etc, only using the metro for a visit up the to Olymipic stadiums and areas. There are some shops and restaurants near to the hotel (next street) and we ate or drank locally several times. There is a metro station in this area too so it is possible to use public transport very easily. Our favourite area though was the marina and all around the sea-front for lovely walks and sitting in the sunshine. Barcelona is a GREAT city! So much to see and do. We'll definately be back and would consider staying in this hotel again although I may consider somewhere closer to the beach next time.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny & clean hotel in a residential area”
Reviews.Author: RedMiniStapler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the day before our cruise in Barcelona, booked for 2 nights stay but due to canceled flight, we only stayed here for one night. The hotel is in quiet area, and about halfway between the beach & sagrada familia, and few other tourists area so you can walk to places if you want, there's also tram available few blocks from the hotel. Breakfast is 15 euro per person, it's bit expensive but they do have few different selections of food to eat, so I think it's alright for one day thing. I would definitely stay here again next time I travel to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Not what expected...won't book this one again....”
Reviews.Author: Areington
Reviews.Content: Not happy - we booked this hotel on the basis that it had 90% on trip advisor, however it's not as expected! July is one of the hottest months, zircon not working in the room, we arrived this afternoon, went to the poolside, there was no deck chairs the people were laying on the hard concrete on their towels, pool is soooooo small, seriously probably 2meters by 3meters, no kettle in the room, could not even order hot water - response from reception - sorry bar closed, we asked for a cup of tea at 9pm - could not order anything.... There was no drinks in our fridge, they don't take your suitcases to your room, you have to manage yourself. Not doing breakfast here as £15 per person is not worth it. Not really in a nice area, rather book closer to las ramblas! Definately don't get what you pay for at all!

Reviews.Title: “Too hot!”
Reviews.Author: gaz8080
Reviews.Content: Basically, the air conditioning didn't work and it made it very uncomfortable to sleep. Otherwise it's a pretty decent hotel in a quiet residential area, quite easy to get to the beach and Ramblas though.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced hotel - look around as you will get much more for your money!”
Reviews.Author: DeeDeeandLuke
Reviews.Content: Checking into the hotel, was located a room at the front of the building which was noisey as the window did not shut properly, was given a choice of another room once we complained but this appeared to have the same problem. Corridor carpets were dirty/stained/smelly although rooms were clean. Have stayed in Barcelona before and got better value for money/qualify hotels. I would suggest you look around and avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: Rossc007
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is in a good location, 5 minutes in a taxi to Port Olympic, which is very lively at night and has a beautiful beach area with alot of resteraunts. The room was clean with modern furniture and a flat screen TV. The pool is like alot of pools in Barcelona, very small. On arrival at the hotel we very greeted by a member of staff who told us that they would not be able to honor our booking of a non-smoking Double room. He was less than apologetic and we where told "We don't guarantee rooms". Had I known that before hand I would not have booked there, Im sure many people can empathize. We where offered either a smoking double or a non-smoking twin, we took the non smoking twin which in fairness was not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel in a quiet residential area”
Reviews.Author: NoName25
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights with my spouse in February. The hotel was clean, quiet and well maintained. It is located in a residential area within walking distance of most major tourist sites. There are several authentic, local eateries in the neighborhood. Check out "Dune Restuarant" around the corner. The staff was helpful and spoke enough English. The room was reasonably roomy and the bed was comfortable. The only problem was the room was a little stuffy even in February and even with the a/c on full. Fortunately, the windows opened, so we made do. A decent but expensive (15 Euros) breakfast is available. Cheaper choices nearby. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value deal”
Reviews.Author: almost-thirty
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a city break in Feb 2011. V friendly and helpful staff, great value package through lastminute. Buffet breakfast included, good quality food and nice selection of continental breakfast items.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel with good prices”
Reviews.Author: schaefer1010
Reviews.Content: I got a rate for less than € 50,- per night at expedia, which is a good price for Barcelona. The auditori is located in the north of Barcelona, 8 squares from Plaza Catalunya, the final stop of the aerobus from the airport. Rooms are o.k., although the sink in the bathroom was leaking. Water in the minibar is for free, as well as wifi. There is a tiny pool on the roof terrace which has more a decorative character, but as it was winter, I did not use it anyway. The restaurant offers set lunch at € 10,-.

Reviews.Title: “Really smelly reception and poor wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: Mirmasmith
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the confortel Auditori in late December. The wi-fi is set to disconnect every 5 minutes and the reception is very poor in the room. In our case, we could only getting by the room's door. The hotel reception has a rather strong sewage smell. The rooms are a good size but the bathroom could do with some deep cleaning, especially tile joints.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: rhalpin10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 20 mins walk from las ramblas. Good value for money compared to other hotels located in surrounding area. The reception is moderrn and bright but somehow lacks an atmosphere, quite clinical. The staff were not overly friendly but they were professional and check in and check out was very fast. The bedrooms are quite small and very dark. Buffet breakfast was really nice and good value for money. Overall this hotel is fine if you are on a budget but next time I would pay the extra money for something a little bit nicer and closer to las ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but with still a long way to go”
Reviews.Author: alyyz
Reviews.Content: I stayed there at the beginning of october (10/3 to 10/7 for 4 nights). The lobby is roomy and is bathed in daylight. I was assigned a room on the 5th floor (right in front of the elevator) by a very pleasant lady front desk agent. Upon entering the room, it looked very contemporary with a view of the street. Although the room is seemingly clean, I couldn't help but feel a bit uneasy as to the hotel's cleaning standard; I'm refering to the washroom specifically, the glass door was moldy at the base, mold which could have been easily removed had the cleaning person used some bleach, my sheets were probably changed daily but I had doubts... I had the chance to try one breakfast, the selection comprised of hams, cheeses, fruits, juices, rice cakes, eggs ( I had mine fried). bread, croissant. but I thought it to be on the pricy side. The area surounding the hotel isn't the best, Arc de triumf subway is a 5-10 minutes walk depending on your pace. Although most of the staff was professional, I do have a complaint regarding two staff members: One of the front desk lady (the Penelope Cruz lookalike) I wanted to ask her some directions on a map, but her lady was on a personal call with a friend for a good 3 minutes while I was standing there right in front of her waiting for her to finish. Another incident again involving her was I was ignored while at the front desk, and she DARED attending to a guest that came after me, I didn't say anything about the incident but spoke harshly to her, and she was so embarassed she couldn't even look at me straight in the eye (especially since she knew what had happened and didn't apologize). Two the cleaning lady at my floor a young spanish girl gave me a lot of dirty looks which made me wonder even more about how well she cleaned my room. I was appalled by those attitudes, and think it might have been racially motivated. Besides those incidents, I must emphasize the remainder of the staff was polite and friendly. Although the price was good, I will not stay at this hotel again prefering to stick to an international brand. BARCELONA however is a wonderful friendly city one must visit.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: TheChadi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a few steps away from the Estació del Nord Bus Station and the Arc de Triomf metro stop. The area is ok and walking to Plaça de Catalunya from here is just 20 minutes. The area is quiet and all but has everything you need in the vicinity. The rooms are average, the staff were nice. For a last minute hotel and the price I got, I think this was a great catch at the time. The minibar was stacked with water bottles which were offered for free, a nice gesture I would say. Overall, good stay in an average location.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: BTN
Reviews.Content: As other reviews have said, nothing really stands out about this hotel - it's clean, smart, quiet and comfortable. Don't bother with the breakfast, an excellent cafe is one block south and turn right - 1 minute - and costs a third of the price. And on the subject of food, Barcelona isn't in general too good at it. If you don't want very average tapas again, or a very expensive visit to the Barcelonette restaurants, you're down to the very average all day breakfast - which is a long way of recommending a chinese three blocks west of the hotel. It's as grimly lit as the other local eateries, but has really good food served by friendly people. Eating away from the hotel, those in the Maremagnum are good and reasonably priced. Getting to the hotel from the airport. First get free map from the tourist booth at the right hand end of T2 as you leave the aeroplane. You're going to need it. Go to the very far left end of T2 and get the train. There are no signs till you get close. Buy a T10 ticket from the machine. All the family can use it, just pass it back to the next person as you go through the turnstile. The T10 is the cheapest and best way to get around. Get off at Sants, and make your way to Arc de Triumph station then walk. A lot of tunnels and stairs are involved. It's more changes than going to Tetuan, but at least when you get out you aren't at a cross roads where every direction looks the same. Some time in the 19th century the Barcelona city planners decided it would be a great idea to make huge chucks of the city look exactly the same, and the Auditori is on a crossroads looking just like hundreds of others. Counting blocks outside the old part of the city is essential. Both the Sagrada Familia and the old city are reasonably comfortable walks, but you'll soon need the T10 again to get back. to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bland : nothing to really recommend or criticise!”
Reviews.Author: wesley66
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and whilst it was ok, nothing really stood out to criticise it or make me want to return. It lacks any real atmostphere and whilst the rooms, and the hotel in general, is clean, that is the only thing that stood out! We had an internal room on the first floor - which was quiet - but could not see the sky so had no idea what the weather was like every morning. TV only has 2 English news channels but if you're out and about every day that is not going to bother you. It takes about 15 - 20 minutes to walk into town but is right next door to the bus station for buses to Girona airport. All in all, there was nothing to complain about but am sure I won't remember this hotel in a years time.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel nearby the city center”
Reviews.Author: Manu73Paris
Reviews.Content: On my arrival I was first given a room on the 5th floor but when opening someone was already in it ! I was then given room number 318. Staff was very friendly & helpful Rooms are spacious, clean, well equipped but maybe you want to avoid sleep on the street-side if you're easily waking up due to noise.... In my room there was a problem the shower since you had water coming out both ends (tap & shower) which wasts water unnecessarely. Also i found a wall-plug that was completely stripped naked which can be dangerous as well. Otherwise very good hotel ! Near to Sagrada Familia (15min walk), Plaça Catalunya/La Rambla (25min walk)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: topcat27
Reviews.Content: This was a great find. Really good value, room was a good size, lovely bathroom, and only about 10 mins walk from Playa da Catalunya, or about €7 in a taxi from the centre of town. Buffet breakfast each morning yummy too. Staff lovely on check in and out - there are no downsides to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Solid stay”
Reviews.Author: CuyChactado
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Barcelona and the hotel didn't hinder us in any way. It's very clean and the rooms although small are a perfect place to rest your head after a long day walking round Barcelona. I wouldn't recommend the breakfast, it is overpriced and didn't look that special so each day we headed for a small Catalan cafe on route to the Arc de Triomf metro stop for a nice coffee and croissant. Would stay again when in Barcelona as it's cheap and no hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced. Heed my warning & book...”
Reviews.Author: LeilaLA
Reviews.Content: Way overpriced. Heed my warning & book in advance so that you can get a better hotel. I would say that auditori is okay for a budget, except it is more expensive than some of the beautiful boutique hotels at which we stayed. Wayyyy too much to spend for mildewed bathtubs, stained wallpaper, and a lampshade covered in brown stains. Eww.

Reviews.Title: “excellent last minute booking”
Reviews.Author: mandy-7
Reviews.Content: After my ferry was delayed and therefore I missed my connecting train in barcelona to Paris I needed somewhere to stay overnight. After searching trip advisor a friend in the uk booked this and it was ideal. Clean, modern and comfortable. Highly recommended after a stressful day!

Reviews.Title: “Barcelone city trip”
Reviews.Author: josdh
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel, ideal for a city trip since it is only 200 meters away from the bus station where all Girona transfer buses are stopping. Also only 5 mins walk away from Ciutadella park (Arc de triomph). Hotel rooms were just okay in size. A little warm but there an HVAC (which takes a little time to cool off). Only Spanish and international stations on the TV but that is not where you are coming for to Barcelona. Breakfast was good. fresh and enough. We got breakfast for 2 persons for the the price of one (EUR 13.95). Free WIFI in the hotel, accesible in your hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for good price”
Reviews.Author: BeamMeThere
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, but since the price is inexpensive, getting 2 rooms was good for a family of 4. It is no frills but that's ok when I goon vacation I don't spend anytime in the room. As others have stated, they provide free bottle water in the frig which is really helpful since its hot in Spain! The location is fairly central but you do have to walk at least 20-25 minutes to get to anywhere. The good news is that taxi rides from most places seem to be around 5-6euros so we usually walk out and taxi back at night when we're tired. The daytime desk person was really helpful. She helped me call Aer Lingus multiple tries about lost luggage. NOTE: make sure you know the intersection of the street the hotel is on. The main street its on (Ausias March) is a big one and sometimes Taxis have a hard time finding it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: CZoof
Reviews.Content: This hotel was within walking distance from tourist attractions. We walked to Gaudi's Sagrada Familiar, Las Ramblas, Gothic quarter etc, with no real difficulty. Taxi's are not expensive to return to the hotel after a long day out (varied between €5 and €8). The hotel itself was clean, the staff welcoming and helpful. It has the feel of a far more expensive establishment. They did not charge for 3 days parking in their secure garage (Caution if you use the garage, it has narrow ramps going down a couple of floors... glad to get my car out without any scrapes.. lucky the wife wasn't driving!) The roof top pool seemed very small, but we never used it, so that didn't bother us. Would use the hotel again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Safe choice”
Reviews.Author: cristina_r32
Reviews.Content: It was our second time at the Confortel Auditori and it was as good as the first time. The rooms are very clean and big enough, the bed is dangerously confortable (better than home), the staff is very helpfull and speaks good English. The location was great gor us; it's 3 min walk to the Metro, 5 min walk to the tram, 2 min walk to a big supermarket, 10 min walk to the Ciutadella park, 15 min walk to the Sagrada Familia, 25 min walk to Placa Catalunia and best of all, 15 min walk to a Mango outlet store (on Girona street). We will most probably stay here again for our future visits in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Confortel July 2010”
Reviews.Author: jenjacknick
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights at this hotle. the rooms were perfect and we had an additional bed for my son. The location Arc de Triomf is two metro stops from las Ramblas. Locally there is a small tapas bar Dunes which was fab!!! We had breakfast included in our deal and found on the last day that you could ask for fressh cooked eggs from the kitchen, anyhow not a biggie. The pool is a little small but ideal to refresh you after a day in the city. All in all a great hotel. Word of warning there is no bar but there was no issue with us purchasing abottle of wine at the supermarket and drinking it in the lobby with glasses and corkscrew provided by reception whilst our 8 year old played on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: jddorian
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from July 3 -7. The fridge was filled with plenty of water each day - something we missed in our other hotels! As others have said, it's a little out of the way, but we didn't find it too far out. Buy a 10 ride metro ticket for the price of 6 single rides. The rooms look just like the pictures on their website. The beds were nice and the air conditioning worked great. There are two slow computers in the lobby. They wouldn't read my usb card reader though, so that was a bummer. The wireless signal worked fine, but I wanted to upload pictures. The reception was nice and spoke enough English, although once they found out I spoke passable Spanish, that's what they preferred. We found the neighborhood to be closed up and quiet on the weekend, but rather smelly. Helped with the noise - made it hard to find dinner. We didn't stay in the neighborhood much - it was easier to ride the metro back to Las Ramblas. There is a grocery store around the corner, which was nice. Don't pay the 7 euros for breakfast. Walk around the block to the Bracafe or across the street to the bakery. We also heard the garbage truck - on the weekdays it was much noisier. The pool was really tiny. We went up once, but didn't actually use it. Overall, this was the nicest hotel we stayed at (out of 6 hotels). It was out of the way, but clean, modern and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect...”
Reviews.Author: ivonne80
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with my boyfriend for 8 days. The room was cosy, clean and a fridge in the room was very helpful as well, every day refilled with new water:) The service room was great too. Air condition in rooms, and fast internet. Reception team very helpful, and friendly. We left a camera in swimming pool, they called us just 30 minutes after to tell us that someone found it. The swimming pool small but also a very good escape to cool yourself, and not busy at all. Close to supermarket, bakery, and restaurant. Close to beach and Plaza de Catalunaya ( 20 minutes).The trip from airport BCN took us 30 minutes, and costed 6euro. The hotel is just one minute from Arc de Triompf metro station. I would come back there definitely. We also enjoyed the World Cup final there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel relatively close to the city center”
Reviews.Author: hesspoint
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Confortel Auditory for 4 nights during Easter. It was a good home-base for exploring the city. Though not exactly dead-center it was a five minutes walk to the subway and about 15 min. all the way into the Gothic Quarter. The Hotel itself was good and clean but nothing special. What was a little annoying though was that between 11pm and 1am the garbage people came by every 15 min to empty yet another container. But no biggie. If you want a nice clean place to stay not too far from the center without spending an arm and a leg, this is it. If you look for some special, stylish and ultra hip place, probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Great value so long as you don't mind a bit of a walk!”
Reviews.Author: Clowd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights, first time in Barcelona. Felt we got a good deal on the price we paid. The hotel is nice, basic, but comfortable and modern. On the roof there's a plunge pool, and is great when you've been out exploring all day. There are a couple of cafes near by, but we found them a little unfriendly! It is about a 15minute walk to the Arche / El Borne area, but as I say, it's great value if you don't mind a bit of a walk. Our room was spotless and roomy, but it was very dark, next to no natural light.. It's a good spot.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: caz_rAustralia
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently enjoyed five nights at Confortel Auditori during our holiday in Barcelona. I had read many of the reviews before booking it, so I had an expectation of the hotel which proved to be about right. I would say that we got a fantastic deal via expedia so we were very pleased with what we got. Some comments: 1. Location A bit out of the centre of the city (centre is Place de Catalunya, right near the main street of La Ramba). It's a 20 minute walk which doesn't feel safe at night time so I wouldn't recommend it. It's a 5 minute walk to the Arc de Triomf metro stop, and everything is really easy to access from the metro. To get to the hotel from Barcelona Aiport, when we arrived at Terminal 1 we took the free shuttle to Terminal 2, where the trains leave from. We bought a T-10 ticket for 8 euro (allows 10 trips on the Barcelona Public Transport system), and took the train to Barcelona Sants station (it was about three stops). Once there, you need to go to Platform 8 to take the metro to Arc de Triomf station. Once you get out of the metro station (a lot of stairs with luggage!), you´ll see the Barcelona Nord station. You should cross the road and then walk along the Barcelona Nord station to get to the hotel (you need to ask someone or look at a map - it´s hard to explain). It took about an hour to get to the hotel, but was definitely far cheaper than taking a taxi. On the way back to the airport, we caught a taxi from the hotel to Place de Catalunya for 6 euro, then took the ´Aerobus´ straight to the airport for 5 euro per person. This was definitely a faster and more pleasant option with luggage! It does work out more expensive though if you are on a tight budget - the first option costs 80 euro cents if you get the T-10 card! 2. Rooms Our room was comfortable and clean. The only thing I would say is that the bedside lights are extremely irritating because you can only have them both on together or not at all! Wasn't good if one person wanted to read later than the other. Air conditioning in the room which is very effective. The curtains need to be replaced as they didn't quite close together properly, but didn't mean people could see in. 3. Breakfast We really enjoyed the breakfast provided each morning. For one thing, it had a good timeslot of 7am til 10:30am. So many hotels only provide an hour window which might not suit. We also enjoyed the variety in the breakfast - being from Australia we are used to fruit and cereal at breakfast, which was provided, as well as the more traditional European breakfast of meat and cheeses with breads. 4. Pool The pool is tiny (think about 4 m by 4m!) but it was lovely to have a swim after a big day of sight seeing. The hotel really really needs to get some more loungers though! There are only six up there (the pool is on the roof) so people kept coming up then leaving as there was no where to sit and relax. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay in the Confortel Auditori. It was great value for money. The hotel also provides bottles of drinking water in the fridge for free which we really appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Linea2
Reviews.Content: ... after reading all the fine reviews we expected more. There was a not so nice smell in general all over the hotel. The pool area was fine, but not suitable for more than 4-6 people - it was extremely crowded - so we gave up. The light at the bed side did switch of in two - so yes, you have to coordinate when to turn it of with your partner. There where a constant mildew smell at the bathroom. We also needed an iron one day - but that was not awailable at this hotel. Our first morning we woke up to a drilling machine - at 8.30 p.m.!!

Reviews.Title: “very good.”
Reviews.Author: Luca_e_M
Reviews.Content: few meters from the autobus and metro stations. staff polite, gentle and available. room and stairs clean and fairly quiet. We would recommend it to anyone who wants peace, courtesy, cleanliness and functionality. We hope to return. L&M Italy - Torino

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alenka77
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a little further from the center than we expected. Still it was a reasonable walking distance and the good thing about it was it was on a very quite street. We also got a room facing the back (so nothing ever woke us up!). The hotel stuff was friendly and nice, the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “What an awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: janda0808
Reviews.Content: We short listed about 10 hostels/hotels for our stay in BCN and chose Confortel Auditori in the end because we wanted a more luxuary hotel after a 8 day tour in Morocco. We are very pleased with this choice. The hotel is located about 5 minutes walk from the Arc De Triomf Metro station (take the Napol exit) on Line 1 which is handy to most important tourisy spots. The downside of this location is that the Metro system in Barcelona isn´t very suitcase friendly but I guess any other location away from the airport would have been the same anyway. The hotel room is sparkling clean, comfortable, elegant, very attentive room service, has a safe, strong shower and quiet. The front desk staff were not always busy as stated in some other reviews and we found them very friendly and helpful. We do have two suggestions for Confortel Auditori though: 1. Not enough light in the room, especially above the bed 2. The wireless internet was really weak. We had to use the public computers in the lobby most of the time. Personally, I think what makes this hotel really good is the room service. They really do up your room and every day we came back from some tiring long walk the room was clean and ready for us to take a nap. There were even complimentary water bottles in the fridge! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting BCN.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: swav__gav42
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a good location. For us it was really handy because it is 100 yards from the drop off bus station for the ryanair connecting bus to girona. The room was fairly small but always clean and good facilities. The hotel itself is modern. There is a big time window for eating breakfast, which I like. The breakfast was excellent, we had included it in our booking. The staff were fine but we didn't need to deal with them much. The location is a walk from everywhere, but this is true of any hotel in barcelona, because all the sites are fairly spread out, as in any city. It is really handy for a nice walk past the arc de triomphe and parc de la ciutadella, while only being 15 minutes from la rambla and 20 minutes from the ports. I would definitely go back to this hotel, and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChiGoody
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week with a friend. Great thing is they have 2 twin beds that come apart so you're not sleeping on top of each other. Front Desk were nice and helpful. It's about a 15 minute walk from the main square. About 5 minutes walk to the nearest Metro. I thought you could get most places in about a 15 minute walk. Tiny rooftop pool which was actually nice. Air conditioning in hotel was great. Bathroom and room itself were large compared to European standards. Had a great time in the city, just beware of the pickpockets. Got a great rate on www.easytobook.com and would not hestitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Pemakan_Angin
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Tripadvisor reviewers, I chose this hotel, which was excellent for its location. A little away from the frenetic city centre, it was yet close enough to easily get to all the main attractions, either on foot or very short Metro rides. The train/bus transfer to the airport is also very convenient, a taxi costs 30-35 euros. There was a good choice of eateries nearby so that breakfast was no problem, and on the night we arrived, the pizza place across the road served us well. Some points: we found the hotel website rates the same as on other websites, weekday rates were cheaper, the rooms facing away from the street were quieter although the street itself wasn't too busy, and there was no kettle in the room, which was the only negative thing. But to sum up, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: tonecontrol
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very comfortable, and served as a good base for sightseeing in Barcelona. The rooms were decent sized by European standards. The free WI-FI was a major bonus as well/

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money but a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: explorer4321
Reviews.Content: A really good, modern hotel that is clean and very welcoming. The rooms were very modern and offered a good base to explore the city. The only problem we had was that the hotel was not as central as we would have liked, especially as we were on a city break in December and only had a few nights. Furthermore, many taxi drivers could not find the hotel which meant we spent a considerable amount of our time lost. However, if you are not short on time, going in the middle of summer and do not mind a little walk (around 15mins) to get to the main attractions then you cannot go wrong with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN, MODERN, CONVENIENT FOR CITY CENTRE AND TOURIST ATTRACTIONS”
Reviews.Author: LanieandJon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Auditori at the end of March 2010 when we went to Barcelona for a long weekend [3 nights] to celebrate our Wedding Anniversary. The hotel is lovely! We arrived late at night and the Reception Staff were pleasant and friendly. Our room was very good; spotlessly clean, well maintained, quiet and the bathroom was very good also, with plenty of clean towels and generous amounts of toiletries, which helps when you've travelled with hand-luggage only. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel but there's a lovely bakery on the opposite corner of the small square that the hotel stands in and we bought delicious croissant and rolls from there. Around the corner is a bar called Dune which I would also recommend; the food and the service was excellent - it's where the locals eat and you can tell why! There are other bars which serve food nearby, they're all very friendly, we spent one evening watching the football in one of them, after the locals rearranged the tables and chairs so that Jon and I could see the TV on the wall!

Reviews.Title: “great location, good size clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: leanneandtony
Reviews.Content: Great location. The metro is only 10 minutes walk and its two stations to the centre of the city (La Rambla). The rooms were cleaned daily and were spotless. goos size bathroom with a bath and shower.The only issue was the air con, it did not cool the room. It seemed to be a safe area also. The main bus station (international and within spain) is five minutes away.Supermarket across the road which also sold alachol. Free wireless internet in the room. Good hotel for a three star.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Dwap31
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, the check in staff were polite and efficient. The rooms are very straight forward with comfortable bed and good sized bathroom. We made our own way from the airport with a T-10 ticket on the aeroport train into Sants station then get onto the metro to the Arc De Triomf stop. Took about 45-60 mins in total to get to the hotel from the airport and was really very easy and a LOT cheaper than the transfers offered by the tour company. Walk up the diagonal road towards Barcelona Nord Bus staion then the hotel is almost directly opposite. A good position for site seeing either on the Metro or by foot and can heartily recommend the Cantonata Italian across the road for dinner (the pizza is good and the staff make you feel very welcome and allowed me to practice my pidgeon spanish on them). The little pastry shop across the road is good for breakfast and lunch if you do not want to pay for the expensive hotel breakfast (which we didn´t) as they sell fresh made pastries and sandwiches. We were stuck in Barcelona due to the Ash cloud and wanted to go back to this hotel but airline hospitality budget wouldn´t allow it. My fiancee and I would go back to this hotel again as we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect platform for seeing Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: JRich071
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for money - it is rated only 3 stars and is priced as such but it looks and feels like a 4 star hotel. The location is perfect - in a relatively quiet suburb located halfway between the hustle and bustle of La Rambla (10-15 min walk) and La Segrada Familia/La Pedrera (10 min walk). The beach and port are also no more than a 10 min walk away. The service was excellent and while we had a couple of minor hiccups with the room (double beds instead of twin/ plug in shower was broken) - these were quickly and cheerfully resolved by the staff). Great selection at breakfast too, one of the best i've had in Spain. Free internet in hotel lobby. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very satisfied with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JenniferCM
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent 4 days in Barcelona at the end of March. I choose this hotel based upon reviews on Trip Advisor. We were very very satisfied with the choice. The room and the bathroom were clean and adequate size. The beds were comfortable. The free bottled water was a nice surprise. We had a room overlooking the courtyard and it was very quiet. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The 2 free internet computers in the lobby were great as were were travelling during the BA cabin crew strike so I was able to keep updated on the status of out flights. The hotel's location was perfect for us (2 old English ladies) and we enjoyed the walk every day to the sites - all which seemed about 20 mins away. The pizza restaurant across the street was convenient and good for a "light" dinner - staff very friendly. There was a large supermarket very close and the local area cafes all had great cafe con leche and breakfast items. I would definitely recommend this hotel for cleanliness, comfort, location and a great price.

Reviews.Title: “A modern, clean and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Claire104
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent two night here over Easter. Overall we were very impressed with it. The room are minimal but clean and modern. Complimentary water was a welcome touch. Our room was overlooking the courtyard and was very quiet. We didnt pay extra for the breakfast, but instead went to one of the cafes just next to the hotel and paid a few Euros for brekkie there. Location wise, I thought it would be closer to things than it was but I didnt realise in general how spread out Barcelona was. It was about 10-15 mins to Plaza Catalunya which was where the Airport bus drops off/picks up from. It was good to walk to the Sagrada Familia and then we picked up the tourist bus from there. We walked to Port Olympic one evening from the hotel and that must have beena bout 20 mins. Overall a good hotel with friendly service and I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL FOR THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: sanayaIndia
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 2 nights... the hotel was great n centrally located .5 min walk from the metro st.. it was clean n spacious n staff was v v friendly.. breakfast was v nice. nearby italian restaurant was great suggested by the receptionist... abt 35 euros from the airport.. v were very pleased with the hotel ... we had a street facing room still the noise was not too much... thanks to trip advisor we read the reviews there is a super market next to the hotel as well..

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and Central”
Reviews.Author: mradford
Reviews.Content: A slick modern hotel within walking distance of all the sights, this was GREAT for the price. The room was spacious and spotless, there was secure parking underground and the staff were helpful. Rooms at the front of the hotel had considerable noise from the road but those facing the courtyard were very quiet. The restaurant food wasn't cheap but was very good. We never had to use public transit and in 3 days saw most of the important Barcelona landmarks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: teamcooperuk
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my girlfriend for two nights and have to say that we found the hotel fantastic. The room was clean and at night very quiet. The location was very handy for flying in from Girona - the bust station is about a minute away. Plus, the Arc De triomf Metro station is about 3 minutes away - two stops and ten minutes max you are at the top of Las Ramblas. Perfect! Special mention to Dean on reception as well who was always friendly and willing to recommend bars and restaurants. He even rang to book a flamenco show for us. I would dfeinitely highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great staff, conveniant location.”
Reviews.Author: dhaka71
Reviews.Content: First time I've been a solo traveller and good accomodation was a must. I booked this place soley off the reveiws as I have done previously before, and I would recomend this place to family, friends and fellow trip advisors. The place is clean and I thought excellent value for money. If I went back to Barcelona (I hope to soon) I would not hesitate to book again (if there was'nt a price increase)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible english/service of receptionist; completely inflexible with their "policies"”
Reviews.Author: thefashionjunkie
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel and prepaid for everything on 1800hotels.com with a whole group of people going for a conference in barcelona. On the weekend of travel, easyjet cancelled many flights to barcelona forcing some of us to cancel in the very last minute. We could not get our money back as it was too late to cancel, but some of my other colleagues made it so I called the hotel hoping to transfer my room to them since I did not want to waste the booking. With no good reason at all, I was told bluntly by the receptionist that it was their hotel "policy" to not be able to transfer the room, and that they're "fully booked" for the day as well (which had me wonder if I had really showed up would they actually have a room for me!). When asked to transfer to the manager, the receptionist simply told me to call back on Monday, by when my reservation would be over. I was completely unimpressed by the inflexibility and lame reasons given for the rejection when I was simply asking to give my room away to someone who was already staying at the hotel (sharing rooms with other colleagues) and that such a big group of us made reservations there (bringing them all this business!). Will definitely NOT waste my time with this place next time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but lacking in some typical amenities”
Reviews.Author: pinemartin22
Reviews.Content: I stayed there three nights while attending a conference near Mont Juic. Overall I was very satisifed with the hotel, and based on other reviews was what I expected. Access to the Metro was very good -- turn left out of the hotel, take your first right on a walking street, Carrer de Ribes, and in 3 short blocks you're at the Arc de Triumf station (but note that there is both a train stop AND a metro stop there, so if you want the Metro, follow signs for M). As far as the hotel, I was surprised that they have no irons available whatsoever. Another reviewer reported irons, but no boards, but apparently now it's just no irons. Fortunately the water pressure and heat is fantastic, so I hung up my shirts and cranked some hot water to steam the wrinkles out, which worked great. Another surprise was that there was no alarm clock (or any clock) in the room. And for the life of me I could not call the reception desk - when I dialed '0' it just rang through, and trying '9' etc. didn't work, so it was a walk down to the desk to ask for one. All wake up calls were right on time, as was the taxi I ordered at 4am (ugh) for my 6am flight home. Finally, I agree with the other reports that the room was very warm. It was pretty cool there - our highs this week were ~50 degrees F, so it was easy enough to open the large window, but during warmer days I could see that could be an issue. The staff was quite friendly, and for a basic hotel in a convenient location to metro/bus, it was a fine place to be. By the way - I'll review it seperately, but if you have time, do yourself a favor and go on the Fat Tire Bike Tour -- it's 4 hours, and really fun. See my review there for more details.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way hotel - Just barely does the trick”
Reviews.Author: travelerrph
Reviews.Content: At the surface, this is a nice hotel. They've redone everything and the furniture and rooms have modern polish. When you dig a bit deeper it's a bit worse off. The curtains don't close properly, the TV's are tiny (who watches tv while traveling, but anyway), the sink was broken. On the positive side, it's the most eco-friendly and handicapped friendly hotel I've ever stayed at (more below). We ended up switching through 3 rooms in our 1 week stay. The first night they didn't save us a regular room though we'd paid for the week on Orbitz. We ended up in a handicap room which meant that it had different hangers, phones, shower, sink, toilet, etc. There was no toilet paper and I had to go down to the front-desk to get some. We then switched the next day into another room and though the hotel is no-smoking, some jerk had smoked a country worth of Marlboros. The room stank and they didnt' have any to switch us into (it was Mobile World Congress - 50,000 mobile phone execs come from around the world - if you're not traveling for the show, don't come that week). Our clothes smelled and we moved again as soon as we could (3 days later). The final room we are in is nice, but has a broken faucet and the curtains don't close entirely (just like the first two). I don't want to make this place sound too bad, because it does the trick. It's just far from everything except the metro (Arc de Triomph) which means you can't just walk out of your hotel and go a couple blocks to great restaurants or museums; it had its share of issues, which may have been unique to us; and is still nice enough that if you were traveling on business, wanted to save money instead of Le Meridien or W, it would do the trick.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, and handy if you're flying in/out of Girona”
Reviews.Author: Pelle123
Reviews.Content: As per all the other reviews, although it doesn't feel enormously personal, it perfectly meets the needs for a short city break. And it's great value. Very close to the Bus station that you arrive / leave from if flying into Girona. Quite handy for a few metro stations, and not a terribly long walk to the old part of the city. The pool on the roof is more of an over-sized bathtub - not that we were bothered about that in November. The bathrooms themselves were spacious, clean and modern - as was the room as a whole - and a very comfy chair for lounging in...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: S2Anna
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located perfectly for us, no more than a 10-15 minute walk from everywnere. Also 1 minute walk to the bus that runs to Girona airport. The hotel was pretty nice, loved the fact that they re-stocked the 6 small bottles of mineral water every day, very handy for taking out and about. The pool was way too small (we had an idea that this would be the case from reading reviews) but it was also badly in need of a clean. Apart from that everything wwas very good, especially the very helpful reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “As good as Tripadvisor reviews said it was”
Reviews.Author: martymouse
Reviews.Content: We decided at the last minute to go to Barcelona and used Lastminute.com to look for a hotel. The associated reviews from Tripadvisor gave this hotel an excellent 4.5 out of 5 so we took the plunge. The hotel is situated a little way from the main attractions, but let's put this into perspective; Plaza Catalunya/la Rambla is 2 metro stops or less than 15 minutes walk. Arc de triomph metro is literally 5 minutes walk away. Sagrada Familia is about 20 minutes walk. You can tell, we walked mostly. You could get the metro, it is quick and cheap. So location was fine for us. The Nord bus station is also very close (5 mins) if you want to use the bus services. The first impressions are good. It is small-ish and friendly, clean and contemporary with very helpful staff. Check-in was quick and easy and we got a 6th floor outside room. The rooms are also small-ish but not at all cramped. Everything you need is there. The in-room safe was useful so we didn't need to carry every valuable with us. The double bed was comfy, if a little firm for my tastes (but my partner thought it just fine). The bathroom has plenty of space and a great shower over the bath - it is nice to have the choice. There were a few small drawbacks which may be useful to other visitiors but none that caused us any qualms. Really it feels like nit-picking; * the hallways and rooms can be a bit warm (in December!) - but the rooms have air conditioning/heating. * if you leave the windows open, then expect some racket throught the night as the bins get emptied, cars and buses go past and the city just does its thing. * breakfast buffet is a little expensive, at 13 euros, but there are plenty of small bars/cafes within a block that do coffee and a croissant for 2-3 euros. Depends what you want. * the hotel does not offer evening meals (apart from a tie up with the local pizza delivery firm) so you'll need to go out - which is not a problem in Barcelona. You can halve the cost of the pizzas if you walk to the delivery office yourself - about 2 blocks. * no english language channels on the TV - another good reason to go out and enjoy the city! At the end of our stay we checked out at 12:00 noon and the hotel was happy to keep hold of our cases until we were ready to go to the airport. Getting to the hotel from the airport depends on who you fly with. If you fly into T1 then get the airport bus just outside to Plaza Catalunya (5 euros single) and then metro or walk or cab to the hotel. From T2 you have a choice of bus or train, the train goes from T2 - every 30 minutes. T1 and T2 are opposite sides of the airport and the link bus takes 10-15 minutes to get from T1 to the station/T2. Going back, and being much wiser, you have a choice.
