Reverse the metro/bus route or try the train. The train is really cheap if you have the time. From Arc de triomph metro to the airport cost us about 80 cents each! We got the hotel at a great rate which added to our overall satisfaction with our stay; less than £45/night for the two of us. Would we go back again? Absolutely, both to enjoy Barcelona and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: GowerTraveller
Reviews.Content: Having never stayed with this chain before we did not know what to expect, other than it would be a basic 3 star. When we arrived, we were very pleased with the high standard and facilities of hotel, which included a swimming pool and gym. The reception staff spoke very good English, were very helpful and pleasant. The room was very clean, modern and well equipped, which included the mini fridge and the daily complimentary bottled water. However, the only complaint with the room was it was a bit too warm! It was in an excellent location to all the main sites (Sagrada Familia and Arc de Triomf), supermarkets and a main bus station (Barcelona Nord). Overall, excellent hotel choice and would definitely stay here again and recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good place to stay. Clean and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: melonfawn
Reviews.Content: We weren't blown away by this hotel, but what do you expect? It's a 3 star hotel, and for that rating it fares pretty well. My mother always told me when travelling in mainland Europe, remove one star from the star rating to equate it to what is expected in the UK and North America, and this advice has always worked. Confortel Auditori is relatively near a metro station, about 2 blocks away. There are two supermarkets, a bakery and a pharmacy all in a one-block radius. The pharmacy was of particular importance to us as my spouse developed a particularly nasty case of gastric flu after eating at a restaurant in Las Ramblas (that's a story for a whole other review). Having a pharmacy so close was a godsend. The hotel staff were very sympathetic and as helpful as they could be during the time he was ill, sending up bottles of water and providing me with the cutlery and crockery I wanted in the middle of the night when the time finally came right to eat again. The bathroom is very clean. The sheets were of course clean but I didn't feel completely at ease in the bed - perhaps the discovery of a hair not belonging to myself or my partner was enough to throw me off that first night. The knowledge the hotel staff have about Barcelona is good, not amazing but not terrible. Restaurant recommendations were the hardest thing to get out of them. The hotel boasts free wireless, although with a Mac I found the first night I couldn't connect to their system, so I had to use one of the 2 computers in the lobby instead. The rest of the time it was no problem to connect. Overall it was an alright hotel, but I don't particularly feel any loyalty to stay there again. If we were to return to Barcelona we would probably stay elsewhere just so as not to stay at the same average place twice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for the price and only 2 stops away from La Ramblas !!”
Reviews.Author: schern
Reviews.Content: 2 blocks from the bus station and train station and 2 stops from Catalunya (la Ramblas) the hotel is really nice and the service is great! would recommend if you want to be close to la ramblas and not have to pay an arm and a leg for a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Really happy with our hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: subzeror
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect for us - it was about 5 mins walk from nearest metro (arc de triomph) and around 20 min walk to either the port or the old part of town. Although we spent most of our time in the centre, it was nice to be able to get away from all the craziness to the area of our hotel - which was a quiet, pleasant, pretty neighbourhood. Our room was very quiet and clean. It was a bit smaller than I'd hoped - we'd booked a twin room but the beds were very close together - this was easily sorted by pulling one of the beds across the room a bit. Bathroom was also clean and had a fab shower - really powerful. The only gripe about the room was the temperature - it was far too hot. Neither of us slept as well as we would have liked - even with the air conditioning on the room didn't cool down all that much. I was glad it was November - I can't imagine what it would have been like in Summer! After a bit of investigation, it seemed like one of the main central heaters was on our floor - and next to our room (301) which probably explained it. We had a room on the inside, with the window opening on to the central air shaft - this meant it was a bit gloomy but very, very, very quiet which was ideal for us. Other reviews have complained about the price of breakfast - we thought it was great but we booked through hotels.com so paid around £3 extra a night for breakfast to be included - a definite bargain for what was on offer ie a buffet including tortilla, bread, cheese, meats, fruit, yohurt, cereal, juice, tea and coffee. Nothing wrong with that! It was out of season for the swimming pool and spa facilities so I can't comment on those - we did check them out though and they seemed nice enough. The room did lack some of the extras you might expect to find eg sewing kit but it had everything we needed. Overall, a very pleasant stay which was only marred slightly by the temperature in the room. I would recommend this hotel for anyone looking for somewhere clean and pleasant to stay which isn't right in the centre of all the noise and chaos, but not far away either! The surrounding area felt safe, and the staff in the hotel were helpful and polite. All in all, a great base for a visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, pleasant, good value”
Reviews.Author: Essexwoman_9
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel, slightly outside the centre of time but no problem walking to the main sights or using the convenient metro. Clean rooms, pleasant staff. I agree with other reviewers that breakfast was a bit overpriced - more than 50 euros for 4 of us - but then the exhange rate works against us at present. Very comfortable, not luxury but great as a base for sightseeing. i would come back and would look for the same chain elsewhere in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choise!!!”
Reviews.Author: dimbel
Reviews.Content: Minimal style Hotel Nice and very kind staff Near center of the city Simply... Amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: savy_79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights, and found it quite pleasent. Rooms were very clean, with hygiene sticker on toilet when we moved it to ensure it had been cleaned. Beds were comfortable. We checked in late and this was no problem and checking out was easy with space for luggage storage. We did not have any food here so cannot comment. Breakfast seemed expensive so found some cafes on route which were ok. Staff were helpful and no trouble to find out details for you, though you may have to explain twice as their english is just ok. Some staff were better than others at telling you the best places to eat, clubs or transport. By the checkin desk are leaflets on places to see, look at these as some have some good offers. Free internet acess in lobby is quick as available during our stay. The area is safe and nice and quiet. Is a bit of a walk from the tourist places, however we walked everywhere, was easy and safe. 10 mins to La Sagrada Familia, 20 mins to La Rambla and 20 mins to port olympic (maybe more as you find intresting places on the way). Nice clean stay and very good value for money

Reviews.Title: “A trendy and well located boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LONDONCABDRIVER
Reviews.Content: Booked this as it looked modern, and it is. Rooms are clean and mimimalistic in design,expected of this category of hotel. Walking distance to all the tourist haunts. Staff are very helpful, booking taxis, & doing the BA online check in for us on their computer. Didnt eat there, ate at the Sept Portes - very nice. Bar accross the road was full of locals and you get free tapas with each drink - We watched the Spain/USA match on a big screen. This we found was the best way to round off you sight seeing and is much cheaper and less tourist trappy (cheaper & authentic)

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Andylemond
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. I mean good location, good modern facilities, good service and quite helpful. Breakfast is continental and fills you up for several hours depending on how much you can eat!!! Location was good as there is plenty of good streets to walk round and no trouble at all. ( No hoodies here!) Barcelona itself was lovely but service in restaurants was lousy and they are not very helpful!! Weather in september is great! Avoid main restaurants in port olympic - they will rob you blind if your not careful. Taxi to hotel at night was around 7-10 euros from port olympic and gothic area. Roof terrace pool is like a big bath but you can do atleast 3 x breats strokes!!! Nice place to catch a few rays in the afternoon though! Would i recommend it ??? YES Real nice place!!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel which was part of the pleasure of barcelona”
Reviews.Author: laygatelad
Reviews.Content: I have very little to add to the very positive reviews of this hotel.They are all accurate.The hotel is neat and exact in manner, appearance and service .It has a fitness suite.The room has no tea and coffe-making facilities and ,oddly,the hotel has no bar.But those are the only remotely negative comments I could make about this 3.5 star,confident,slightly understated, gem of a hotel. And Barcelona is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: Kr_and_Er
Reviews.Content: Stayed a whole week at this modern, straight-forward place northeast of the city center. Rooms were big and clean, modern, but not exactly cozy (bare walls, cold gray colouring). Service from staff could have been better, but was really ok. No noise what so ever in our room. A nice little pool on a roof terrace to cool down was a real plus. A great place to stay to seek out all the sights of this marvellous city.

Reviews.Title: “Great for transfer to Girona aiport opposite the bus station! Mini swimming pool and lounging area on roof!”
Reviews.Author: hmitch
Reviews.Content: Right opposite Bus station for Barcelona bus to Girona airport - buses go really often takes just over an hour. Hotel very modern and nice decor, clean and comfortable, mini pool and sunloungers on roof - great for sunbatheing! 2 computers in lobby for free internet use. Room great size - hairdryer in room, air conditioning, TV, desk, maid service every day, refill of free water in minibar every day. Be warned reception do not have an iron! Breakfast - standard international continental - great to start the day. Would say more than a three star hotel! Paid about £280 for 4 nights, including breakfast at the end of july. Few cafes nearby and supermarkets. Best to head towards Ramblas, Gothic area or placa Catalunya for bars and restaurants, about 15-20 mins walk easy to find. About 15-20mins walk in another direction to Sagrada Familia. Metro very easy to use, arc de triompf station about 5 mins away, available 24 hours at weekend, clean, very frequent, cheap - 1.30 euro per journey and busy especially at 1am saturday towards port olympic! Nightlife very good down there, restaurants til midnight then change into lively bars. Used the tourist bus, quite expensive 25 euros but got to see a lot of the city in short space of time. If went again would be more inclined to explore using the very cheap metro! Had a great time, great hotel, quite luxorious in fact, in a quieter area but still not far to explore the city, bonus that there is an area to sunbathe on the roof, with a mini pool to dip in. Very pleased with our choice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: haybelline
Reviews.Content: Really excellent stay - great value for money, modern and fairly large room, very clean. The location was fine for us, not too far from the metro or the main tourist spots but you would have to get a taxi back if going out late into the night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mk5561
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner went to this hotel in November and stayed for 3 nights. We took the hotel bus into the centre of Barcelona and then got a taxi for the short 5 minute ride from the centre to the hotel itself although you could get a taxi to the hotel for around €30. The hotel was modern and looks like was recently renovated. Check in was fast and prompt when we arrived and the room we were given was nicely decorated and of a fairly decent size and included a free mini bar stocked with soft drinks daily. The beds were comfortable and a welcome relief after sightseeing for a whole day. There was also free internet available in the lobby which was convenient for print boarding passes and checking in online for our return flight home. Breakfast was included in the price of the hotel and we thought was very good. Nice selection of cereals, fruits and meats and all the usual stuff. However there is a bakery across the street which served some lovely stuff at very reasonable if you wanted to avoid paying €13 for the Breakfast and something different. Also there is a cracking Tapas restaurant if you wanted to try some traditional Spanish cuisine. The staff at reception were always helpful and advised us of all the best sights to go and see and even gave us a free map which was a nice touch. Location wise the hotel is about 5 minutes walk from the Arc de Triomf metro stop which provided excellent links with the rest of the city but also a pleasant 15 minute walk to the Rambles. In summary we thought the Hotel Auditori was an excellent base to explore Barcelona and would recommend it to anyone looking for clean and clean hotel to stay in while visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Ditsy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for just a couple of nights and consider this excellent value of money. The room and bathroom were very clean, and felt fresh and modern. The room was not the largest, but considering this is a 3* hotel in a city I didn't have expectations for anything much larger! The staff seemed quite friendly and helpful, and it was great that the fridge in the rooms are stocked with free bottles of water (6 every day) which came in very handy. The bed was very comfortable and both nights I had a great sleep. The only negative is that it would be much better if they provided tea and coffee facilities in the room. The swimming pool on the roof top is small, but great for a dip to cool down. The location was good as well - I didn't need to take the metro much at all during my trip as most things were within walking distance. Considering this was £65 per room per night (Expedia), this was perfect for a few nights stay on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stevescott
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Confortel Auditori. By coincidence, we also stayed in the same room 509 that the previous reviewer stayed in. I suspect that the reason she found it a bit noisy was due to the fact that the window would not shut properly, thus letting in some street noise. The room was a reasonable size but certainly not big. The bathroom was also quite modest but big enough. We had a problem with the sink as the drainage pipe under the plug was pretty badly blocked. After a couple of attempts, I managed to get someone to come and fix it. Our breakfast was included in the price which was just as well as I wouldn't have paid the Eur13 that I believe is the normal price. Although the buffet breakfast was adequate, we were beginning to get a bit bored after 3 nights. Don't expect to do much swimming in the rooftop pool as it really is tiny. However, both it and the area around it were a welcome relief at the end of a hot day trudging around Barcelona. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, especially at our rate of £67 a night from Hotelconnect.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel with no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: shelleyN_wales
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending 4 lovely days in Barcelona, i went with my teenage daughter. We had a great time visiting all the sites and spending the late afternoons by the rooftop pool (even though it was more of a dip than a swim because the pool is very small). The hotel is very clean and modern looking, rooms were spotless and we had a continental breakfast included in the price. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The metro system is great for getting around and only a 5 min walk from the hotel however we used the taxis for the return journey back to the hotel after dark. I had my money in a waist purse and we didnt encounter any problems or see anything suspicious during our stay. We used the Aerobus transfer from the city to the airport, the transport system is so easy to use. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip to Barcelona, its a great City not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: wunderlust
Reviews.Content: What a lovely little hotel. Super clean. Friendly staff! From the maids to the reception staff everyone was lovely. Daily waters provided in the fridge - it was a nice touch. Breakfast very nice too. If we hadn't been robbed the last day of our travel in the metro at Arc de Triompf (the nearest tube to the hotel) we may well have gone back to Barcelona and stayed in this little hotel. It had everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay, enjoyed my return visit.”
Reviews.Author: SalemTravelBureau
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Confort Auditori in Barcelona. The hotel looks like the hotel that Ikea built. It is clean, modern and very comfortable. The first time I was there I was a single lady traveler, the last time I was with 16 friends. The hotel should be a 20-30 Euro taxi from the airport, two couples traveling with us got stuck in traffic and their taxi fee was triple. The hotel will arrange a car service for a set fee or the train from the airport comes to city center and then a short taxi to the hotel. We arrived very early from the US and some rooms were ready for check-in, others had to wait until the afternoon. The front desk was very kind and stored the luggage for the guests who did not have rooms. Theguests that needed handicapped accommodations were all given rooms on arrival. We appreciated their being so considerate of the grandmothers in our party. The location is city center. It is a fifteen-minute walk in each direction to major sightseeing. We walked to the hop-on hop-off trolley tour; we walked to the harbor, the cathedral…everywhere. It felt safe and was very convenient. The hotel offers rates with or without breakfast. The breakfast at the hotel is very good if you eat a big breakfast. I wasn’t hungry one day and the maitre’d offered me just juice, at no cost. We went across the street to a great little Tapas bar for hor’s deouvres and drinks and it was so much food it became dinner. The hotel offers free internet in the lobby. The rooms have nice flat screen televisions on the wall. The beds felt hard but everyone commented about how well they slept. The bathrooms are very nice, a little on the small side. The bathrooms have a very high step up into the tub. Not a problem in the handicapped accommodations. I would comment on the postings that rail on the hotel staff. I found them to be cordial, accommodating and professional. Absolutely NO problems with the staff. Both times I stayed in Barcelona was before a cruise. This is a very convenient location for cruise passengers. Would I recommend this hotel, sure! It’s a very good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: mferns82
Reviews.Content: Nice comfortable hotel, clean rooms, good breakfast (included in the package)...15 mins walk to the city centre but 1 min walk to the interstate bus depot which was very handy to us as we flew from Porto to Barcelona and had to fly back to Porto. Friendly staff ...good and fast internet...the staff at reception even printed our boarding passes for us free of charge and gave us lot's of info on places to go and things to see.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: NualaDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights in this Hotel for my 60th birthday. The hotel itself is quite modern and the rooms very comfortable. The breakfast was great. The location is quite a distance from Ramblas, Gothic Quarter and Catalunya, My big worry about this hotel is what happened to us on the first night after arriving back from the long walk. We were very abruptly and rudely spoken to by the night Receptionist (Daniel). He demanded 150 euro from my partner for dinner that evening (we did not eat in the hotel) we ate in a Tapas in town. He said we borrowed the money from his colleague and we must pay him. We could not believe what was happening. We asked him to check the register as we were staying in room 316. He checked and said sorry its room 318. What sort of approach is this. After that I was so angry that I tripped on the carpet and ended up in hospital with fracture of metatarsal. We reported the incident to the Management next day and they apologised and got me a wheelchair. We seen this guy Danil at reception the day we were leaving and I told him I was reporting him in writing which I did before leaving. Is this a SCAM? Ive never heared of anything like this before. Surely if whoever stayed in 318 had not paid for dinner it would be on the bill when leaving. Worst experience of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. good value for money”
Reviews.Author: sandokan
Reviews.Content: if you're looking for a base to go around Barcelona, this hotel can be a good solution. quiet location, 3 min walking from Arc Triomf metro station. 10 min from Sagrada Familia and 20 from Plaza Catalunya. don't go for the breakfast at the hotel. you have plenty of good bar just around the corner and can save a lot of money. booked online and paid 310 Euros for three nights. Double room with added bed for child (free) on the negative side I would mention the shortage of bathroom amenities ( they don't refill shampoo and shower gel if you don't ask) and lack of staff (certain time you have only 1 person to handle all the guests)

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, but small things niggled”
Reviews.Author: Lydia74
Reviews.Content: There are some great reviews of CA, but our experience was not so great. The set-up is more serviced apartment than hotel. Good ~ Good location; easy to get to from Plaça Catalunya, where the airport bus stops, and next to a metro stop. ~ Very modern and spotlessly clean. ~ Large room with comfortable bed and very nice (if cramped) en-suite shower room. ~ Decent breakfast buffet (it was included in package). ~ Free water in in-room fridge. ~ Small fitness centre. ~ Roof-top terrace (with tiny swimming pool) Not so good ~ Our shower took almost an hour to drain. We reported it straightaway, but as it was Sunday there were no maintenance personnel available (the screen is also too small for the very large shower, and the bathroom got soaked as a result – seems to be a common problem with hotel bathrooms). ~ Always a queue for the front desk, as only 1 receptionist on duty at a time ~ Cleaning staff didn’t replace used-up toiletries during our 3 day stay and we had to ask reception for replacements. (The bathroom is supplied with 1 small soap, 1 shampoo and 1 shower gel). House-keeping are great with everything else though, although there was also no soap in the ladies' WC near the lobby. ~ The lighting in the bedroom is terrible, as was the air conditioning – it switched on but didn’t do much to cool the stuffy room. ~ The hotel advertises a safe in every room. There was no safe in ours – they asked us to look again (still had no success), then they admitted that no all rooms are equipped with them. (We had to leave our valuables with reception) ~ There was no iron in the room, nor on enquiring at the front desk did it seem that the hotel had any ironing facilities. Standard Hotel Fittings 101, we would have imagined. ~ We wanted to open a bottle of wine, but locating a corkscrew proved problematic. There seemed to be just one in the whole hotel, and we were stuck when one staff member didn't know where to find it. Shouldn't have been an issue, but it was.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christaras
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel,5 minutes walk from the nearest metro station.The rooms are exactly the same withe the photos.A very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not a quiet hotel at all!”
Reviews.Author: amz988
Reviews.Content: If you stay at this hotel, don't expect to get much sleep! The chamber maids are crashing and banging about from about 8.30am onwards, I have no problem with them cleaning the rooms at this time its just their lack of consideration for guests who could still be sleeping, especially at the weekend. The banging of doors was so loud our own door would shake! The breakfast is ok, however they never seemed to have enough staff working and therefore tables would not get cleared and you would end up with no cup or no fork, etc. I'm sure some of the food had gone off as well as one morning the pineapple tasted like meat! The area the hotel is in isn't exactly picturesque either! Although I didn't find a lot of Barcelona was. Theres graffiti everywhere and dog poo, it just looked a bit run down. I did however like the room itself and the free mini bar full of water, which was re-stocked every day. The free wifi and computers down in reception was also very useful. Also the staff were very friendly but they really need to put another person on breakfast as the poor guy was running round like a maniac! Overall I would stay here for a business trip maybe but not a holiday, as i spent most of our time in Barcelona exhausted!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and quiet base for sight-seeing”
Reviews.Author: KMHarp
Reviews.Content: We are a family of three who visited Barcelona for sight-seeing and stayed for 4 nights at the Confortel Auditori. The hotel is in a residential area (close to Arc De Triomf metro) a couple of metro stops, or a 20 minute walk from the top of Catalunya Place (going West) or Sagrada Familia (going North). The staff on the service desk were very friendly and helpful (eg no trouble getting extra pillows, or leaving our cases on the last day). The rooms are modern, stylish, clean and comfortable. We liked it because it was peaceful after the bustle of sight-seeing - and you will get a good night's sleep. However, you won't get stunning views or lively bars on your doorstep. The rooms have TV (BBC & CNN World News in English), air con, safe, hair-dryer and a small fridge. This was stocked with bottled water (but we didn't get juice or alcohol-free beer as mentioned by others). The hotel has a gym (seems little used - though was pretty good), a very small pool on the roof (more for a cool-down dip than a swim) and free internet access from two PCs in the foyer (which were busy most of the time). We didn't take breakfast as we were room only and at 14 euros each would have worked out to be quite expensive. I would suggest a tea/coffee vending maching would be a useful addition as there is none available after breakfast. One of the reasons we chose this hotel was because we could get a triple room (cheaper than paying for two rooms) as we have one teenager. On arrival we were offered an additional room for the same price - very happy with that. Very close to the hotel you will find a selection of small supermarkets and greengrocers. Also a nice bakery and a number of bars/coffee shops. We also had a very enjoyable meal at the pizza restaurant over the road (not just pizzas). So you can get just about anything you will need close by. Other tips include: We made good use of the Metro and bought the T10 travel card (10 trips for E7.70. Multi-person and transferrable. Used on metro/bus/tram). Access to plenty of cash (or from cashpoints). We found credit cards were not widely accepted, eg by the tour bus and entrance fees to several attractions. We were nearly pick-pocketed whilst out one day (but didn't feel personally threatened) - take sensible precautions. An early bus tour can help you get your bearings quickly. We got a good "map by map" guide from the Tourist Info office at Catalunya Place. We particularly enjoyed the cable car to the castle at Montjuic for great views. Get the Funicular from Paral Lel metro, then the Telerferic cable car. Also Gaudi's Park Guell and Sagrada Familia, a wander round the Gothic quarter, and Barceloneta beach. We were very happy with this hotel. It met our needs very well in terms of a mid-range clean, comfortable and peaceful base with good transport for sightseeing. You'll have a great time in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing breakfast, good location, spacious room!”
Reviews.Author: berttaylorhanson
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on reviews I read here and it lives up the the hype! Our room was clean and much bigger than I expected. The location was perfect for us -- centerally located to all of the things we wanted to see and do. Close to the subway station so we didn't need a car. The best part was the breakfast -- fresh, delicious and included in the price!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in a very convenient area!”
Reviews.Author: ffion443
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2009 for 2 night and thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. It is within walking distance of Plaza Catalanya, and a stone throw away from the Arc de Triomf metro stop. The room are very clean and modern and free internet access. As mentioned by someone else previously the reception staff are also very friendly with amazing English. Would definately go back there!!

Reviews.Title: “beautifull hotel”
Reviews.Author: malekalmalak
Reviews.Content: i loved this hotel, stayed there 3 nights with my girlfriend, Very clean and new, big and sunny rooms, lovely bathroom. very good choice. the rooms are like in a 4 stars hotel... Malek 02/2009

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: SunnyPortugal
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a very quiet and nice stay in this modern hotel during our weekend trip to Bercelona. The hotel is not so close from the famous Barri Gotic but is located in a very quiet district. It takes around 20 minutes on walk to reach either the historical center or the Sagrada Familia, otherwise the metro station Arc de Triumf is just 2 minutes away. The staff at the reception was friendly and helpful. The room was of a good size and very clean. The bed is not the biggest nor the most comfortable but nothing to complain against. A mini-bar is available, always refilled with bottles of water (only water) and it's free of charge. The bathroom didn't have a bath tube but a big shower instead. The ratio quality for price is very good. The only regret is the overpriced breakfast. Better go one block away and take it at the market next to the bus terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: TyttiSi
Reviews.Content: Confortel Auditori is an excellent choice whether your staying for leisure or business in Barcelona. Hotel is located near Park de la Ciutadella and Arc de Triomphe, about 15 minute walk from the Barri Cothic and La Rambla. Hotel was really clean, staff was nice and helpful, and rooms were nicely decorated and quite modern. It was also very calm - if you're looking for a party, this isn't the right place for you. We were really satisfied; Confortel Auditori should absolutely be a 4-star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: emma23london
Reviews.Content: Okay firstly the hotel is very nice, on arriving I was plesently surpised and I would recommend it to others. There were only a few things which i was dissapointed with. After booking the hotel I was told I would have a free mini bar and I was also told I would have a bathroon with a bath tub. After complaining to the receptionist she told me that there were no rooms left with a bath tub and the free mini bar policy had been changed it only had water in and she didnt know why it hadnt been updated on the internet. I know these things may seem trivial but I suffer from a bad back and on holiday I wanted to relax in a nice hot bath. Also on the last night I was there I had a trail of ants coming out from under the shower, but i guess in hotter countries thats to be expected. Other than that the hotel and staff are very nice and i had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “A GEM in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: TravelPrincess
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Confortel Auditori for 4 nights (Dec 14-18) and truly had a wonderful experience. I did my hotel research thru Tripadvisor and several different websites and found a lot of positive reviews on this hotel. We were not disappointed at all! The hotel looks exactly like the photo posted. Everything was clean and hotel staff was very helpful. We called the Front Desk a couple of times and they were always prompt in attending to our requests. We used the 2 computers in the lobby which was very convenient for our internet searches. Having several different beverages in the mini bar was another perk that we loved. It was replenished daily and we couldn’t have asked for more. Best rates we got for this hotel was thru their website (hotelauditori.com). They offer an advance booking discount and rates were very reasonable. Hotel location was great, though we did a lot of walking. Arc de Triomph Metro L1 stop is the station closest to the hotel it was about a 5 minute walk. Per the advise of some reviews, the most inexpensive way to get to the hotel from the El Prat airport was via the Renfre #10 (Estacion Sants) and Metro (Red Line Arc de Triomphe). We purchased the T10 for 7.20 Euros and we were charged 1 Metro ride per person. It was easy, but there are a lot of stairs to handle, so this may not be advisable to travelers with heavy and/or plenty of luggage. We decided to take the Aerobus back which was 4.05 Euros per person. The bus is located at Placa Cataluña right by El Corte Ingles. This is about a 20 minute walk from the hotel. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, instead, bought a variety of breads from the bakery across the street. With cheese purchase from the Mercat de Boqueria and the fresh, delicious baked bread – we were all set for the mornings. We tried a few tapas bars as suggested in different books and websites – our favorites are: Pinotxo at the Mercat de Boqueria, Cerveceria Catalana (Address: C/ Malloca, 236), Euskal Etxea (Placeta Montcada, 1-3 near the Picasso Museum ). For a quick sandwich 24/7, try “Tulip Doner” for a shawarma. It is a 3 minute walk from the hotel on the way to the Arc de Triomphe Metro Station. Get a good pair of walking shoes and start your Barcelona adventure from Confortel Auditori. I would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “hard to fault it!!”
Reviews.Author: AlliH101
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent value. We stayed here for 6 nights and found it the perfect base. The rooms and bathrooms are a good size, and the mini bar is replenished daily. The rooms were spotless. Ours was on the 1st floor, and a bit close to the road, but as the area is quiet and residential it never bothered us. The pool is little more than a splash pool, but is still nice to drop into after a days sightseeing. It is as many other reviewers noted 15- 20 min walk to the Ramblas. Taxi's are only about 5 - 7 Euros, and the Metro is only a few min away. We used the metro a good bit coming home at night rather than walking. A metro ticket for 10 journeys is only €7.00, and this 70c metro ticket will cover your fare back to the airport form Arc de Triomphe. We did not take breakfast any morning as it was not included in our rate. The rate when we stayed there was €15 each, which was a bit steep. We ate in several of the cafe's nearby and had coffee and food for under €8 for the two of us, which was always excellent. There are several good restaurants nearby, check for recommendations in the guide books. One or two are slightly off the main roads, but well worth rooting out. All in all would stay here again, and I will be back to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Should be 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: ladyafro
Reviews.Content: Firstly let me say I am in love with Barcelona and the hotel made it a perfect romantic getaway. Personally I think it should be a 4 star hotel rather than a three, but the only thing that let it down were the staff.... or should I say the reception staff. They were never welcoming and made us feel as though we had stepped into the wrong place on arrival. On our first day we asked for a map so we could see the sites and we were handed over a huge map that folded out so big we couldnt find our starting point, he never offered any help and we had to ask a passer by for direction. It was really only little things that could have made the visit more welcoming, but what really spoiled it was on checking out, we had problems with our bank card going through thier machine and rather than trying to help us sort it out, the receptionist kept telling us to just go and withdraw the cash from an ATM. Eventually it worked and it may just have been a glitch with the system but his attitude spoilt a great weekend. The room was beautiful and the free minibar refilled everyday was a nice touch. It was about a twenty minute walk from the centre, but a five minute walk from the bus station if your coming from Girona. Views from the room not great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: sonianagra
Reviews.Content: We were flying in and out of Girona so main concern was a decent hotel within walking distance to the bus station, and boy was this perfect! We stayed for 4 nights for one 267 Euros without breakfast by booking a deal through the hotel website. The room was spotless, we like to walk so the 20 min to the center was fine. Absolutely no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable hotel, excellent staff, good rates, average location.”
Reviews.Author: Ed-London
Reviews.Content: The Room: The Confortel Auditori was very pleasant. It’s clean and modern and the room was decent for a 3*. We had a proper double bed - rather than 2 single beds joined together - which made a nice change. The bathroom was also nice and ours (at least) was a decent size. We didn’t like the pillows, but they weren’t so bad we felt a need to complain either… As you’ll have read elsewhere – the minibar in the rooms are free, which is a nice touch, and come with Water (still & sparkling), Beer (one regular, one non-alcohol), Coke (regular & diet) and Juice (orange and another). This gets restocked daily. However, there is no coffee / tea / kettle in the room which always bugs me. Also, worth noting that the hotel doesn’t have “proper” room service, they have a contract with a local Pizza chain who will provide delivered pizza / drinks etc – didn’t really bother us but means there’s no room service breakfast for example. Note that we were on the 6th floor (highest apart from the roof) and all the surrounding buildings are the same height, so no views. The Amenities: Breakfast (included in our Rate) was decent, although given the hotel wasn’t too busy when we were there, the seating was rather limited and tended to fill up by about 8:30 / 9am each morning. The food selection was good however and was replenished through the service period. The staff in the hotel were pleasant, in particular the front desk were very helpful in assisting us with restaurant reservations and similar. There are also two free PC’s in the lobby, and free wireless access in the rooms. On the downside however – there were a few times when the Confortel showed its budget hotel roots – requests for tissues, umbrellas (on the first day at least) and power adapters were not met. Lastly there’s a small pool (**small** - a splash pool) on the roof, but we were there in late October and it was too cold to use. The Location: Probably the only (real) minor downside to the Confortel Auditori is its location – it is a bit of a way away from La Rambla (25 minute brisk walk) and the port areas (20 – 30 minutes). We don’t mind as we like walking – but older visitors or families with kids may not be so keen. The local area is peaceful – mainly residential – but on the flip side there weren’t many (nice) restaurants or bars nearby. However, there is a Metro station 5 minutes away, and a further two stations (different lines) within 10 minutes. The tramline is also 10 minutes walk. A major bus depot is next door. The nearest Metro station (Arc de Triomf) is also an FGC & RENFE (railway line) station. So transport links are good. The Metro system is very efficient – though there’s lots (and lots) of steps. Overall: For the competitive rates we paid for our booking (it was low season) we really haven’t got any complaints about the Confortel. When we return to Barcelona (what a great city!) I would strongly imagine we will stay here again! General recommendations: We would recommend walking – the Historic / Old town is actually quite small, and is interesting to walk around. Restaurants – We were lucky to have a local friend recommend some places. Elx in the Maremagnum. Agua in Port Olimpica. Merendero de la Mari in Port Vell. All 3 were really excellent up market restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, modern design”
Reviews.Author: thedreamgl
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel .Stayed there for 3 nights at the end of December 2007. The hotel has a great location. It's walking distance to Arc de Triumph and El Born/Barri Gottic. That would take about 10-15 min. Walk to Pl. Catalunya is 15 min- 20 min. A taxi to either cost us 5-7 EUR. We loved the design. The rooms were spacious, the front desk people quite nice. The only drawback would be the price of a breakfast, which we got once. However, you can choose to go downstairs, where there are a couple of small places that sell the freshest bread and great coffee. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: RexNorway
Reviews.Content: Good location, modern turist hotel. Close to the bus station and metro station. Free minibar is a plus and very good breakfast (as long as you show up early). Two pc's in reception with free internet access. Swimmingpool was very small!

Reviews.Title: “Really Great!”
Reviews.Author: saar_karni
Reviews.Content: Really great hotel, we enjoyed it a lot! Far enough from the center, such that it is not too noisy at nights, but close enough to get there (to Placa Catalunya) by walking in 20-30 minutes. Metro station (Arc De Triomf) is 7 minutes walking from the hotel. Rooms are nice and big, and many facilities are free: mini bar, safe, Internet (2 PCs in the lobby and access point for wireless devices). Breakfast is also very good and the staff is friendly. Recommended hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: micky73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 4 nights in september to celabrate out first anniversary. The locatin is very good as very close to metro station and also from the bus station where there are direct buses for Girona airport. The room was cleaned and the towels were changed daily but what put me totally of this hotel was the bedding. The sheet was torn is two places and the pillow had a big blood stain which was visible through the nearly transparent pillow case. Also when the bed was changed after 3 nights the new bedding had stains on. You could definitly see this was part of a chain hotel as the staff would hardly raise their heads from the computer in the morning to say good morning. I would not stay at this hotel again and not recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: joylls
Reviews.Content: It is a superb 3-star hotel in terms of price (skip breakfast in return of a free minibar and 100 euro per room daily). Trendy room design and quiet surroundings. Easy to access major tourist attractions. However, please note the followings: 1. This hotel keeps the cost well by switching off the air conditioning while u go out and we just got the mere okay cooling with the coolest setting (and the machine just went out of function on the first day). No change of bedsheet throughout the week of stay. 2. 10-minutes walk to La Rambia is okay for runners. For us, a 20-mins walk is a minimum and be prepared to have a good sense on directions in order not to get way lost. If u r lazy enough to get a taxi from la Rambia, get at least 6 euros ready

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Quality and Great location”
Reviews.Author: toon_ada
Reviews.Content: this is a great hotel and its only a short 10 minutes walk or 2 metro stops from the top of La Ramblas. When we turned up our room wasn't ready but it wasn't long before they moved us and enabled us to go and explore. The room was on the inside of the building and was therefore quiet but no view at all. The room was clean and well kept and a good standard. No problems there. Took my swimming gear but didn't bother as my bath at home is bigger ! Its just a short walk of two blocks to the metro and all the walking we did, we never felt threatened or worried by where we were. The only problem as i said was the booking in and that was sorted quickly. If you can get in here, do it.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable Confortel”
Reviews.Author: JCB88
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Confortel Auditori for 6 nights at the end of August. The main appeal of the hotel was that it looked very bright and clean, appeared to be in a decent enough location and was quite inexpensive. The hotel is about a 30 minute "RENFE" ride and 15 minute Metro from the airport. The room itself was actually pretty nice. It was how we expected it- fairly small but big enough. It had a tv on the wall with a variety of channels and a desk/table in the main room, as well as a safe in the cupboard. There was an air conditioner in the room but it didn't really make the room that cool, however, it was adequate. The bed was suprisingly comfortable and quite large. There is also a free minbar in the room with water, sparkling water, coke, juice and beer. In the bathroom there was a hairdryer which is useful, obviously. The bathroom was really clean and stylish, with a large bath. There was a window/door looking out onto the road and it let a lot of light in making the room bright. If you can, request a room at the front because I have read that people with rooms at the back have complained that the room was quite dark. The rooms were cleaned and tidied daily and even if you wake up late you can request that your room is cleaned when you are out. The hotel has a small swimming pool, probably 5 metres long. WARNING: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL LOOKING FOR A LAZY POOL HOLIDAY BECAUSE YOU WILL BE DISAPPOINTED! However, the roof area is quite nice, and has a few sun loungers you can catch some rays on during the day, although these got pretty busy. There is also a fitness room in the basement that is really nice. We didn't even go there until the last day but had i know I would have used it. It is small, but was empty when I went and I don't think it gets too busy. There was also a fridge full of free water in there and air conditioning. The hotel is about a 2 minute walk from the metro station and just around the corner from numerous supermarkets. I have read that it is a short walk from "La Rambla" which is the main road in Barcelona. However, it is quite a walk, but certainly walkable in about 20-30 minutes. But to be honest the metro is really good with air conditioning and you can get to pretty much anywhere in the city quite easily (get a T-10 if you plan on using the metro lots, you get 10 metro trips for about 7€ and you can share it). We found that the area called "El Born" was the best area. It had lots of excellent restaurants, bars and shops, with a lovely square with a cathedral (Santa Maria del Mar) and it was a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel. So, the only negatives were that the staff weren't particularly friendly, but they were efficient and did their job well. Also, the hotel is part of a chain and it did feel like this. You felt a little bit like a number, but this doesn't really matter, as it is only a hotel. I have read reviews where people were disappointed with the Confortel Auditori because they chose it as 'luxury' accomodation. We were very happy with it because we considered it as a 'cheaper' option, so I wouldn't go here if luxury is what you are looking for. Finally, as mentioned before I didn't find the air conditioning cool enough and the sun loungers got very busy. Overall, we were very happy with our stay at Confortel Auditori. It met all our requirements and was very clean and confortable in a nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty much agree with what other people say.”
Reviews.Author: IanH82
Reviews.Content: I have recently came back from this hotel following a 3 day visit in late August with my girlfriend. As many people have indicated in the past the hotel is within a residential area so is off the beaten track rather than the centre, and to be honest I don't think that was a bad thing. We arrived on the mid afternoon into Barcelona City Airport and caught the train into Barcelona Train Station and the connecting journey to the Arc de Triomph, due to my inability to remember the map we had to wing it when we arrived in the area and after some scratching heads we go there. If you do have the same problem this MAY help. If you exit and you are facing the Arc de Triomph building then follow the road round to the left and head towards the bus station which you should see. Once at the bus station there is are a number of entrances to the bus stop but if you have a look for the restaraunt Otobre (or very similar) the hotel is on your right (apologises if there is an easier way to go, but is is where the locals directed us to!), the other exits are actually out at the bus terminal. The hotel was described as many other, free mini bar with water, juice and non-alcoholic lager, a digital safe and air con. The bathroom was equipped with a shower and hairdryer. I do agree that the rooms do not have the best natural light and our room looked into some sort of void into the centre of the hotel so no natural air coming into the room, but as it was only somewhere to rest our heads this is a very minor detail. Our deal included breakfast and was the usual continental style, although had I had to pay for it on a daily basis then possibly not, the free internet acess was also a plus. Taxis to the centre are fairly cheap between 5 and 7 euro and to walk is about 20 mins and is pretty much a straight road which is signposted (similarly on the way back we followed the sign to the arc di triomph). If you decide to get the tour bus the blue line runs near the zoo and is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. To get there walk underneath the arc, down through the couple of parks, the bus stops near the zoo. Barca itself is lovely and I would always recommend it, whilst not a majorly religious person I was taken aback by the Sagrada da Familia which is truly awesome. One thing though, if you get the tour buses now it is an audio journey rather than the rep speaking, everywhere bus stopped in Barca you could see the amount of blue headphones dumped on various bus shelters etc. Overall a very enjoyable break and one a hotel I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but in wrong location”
Reviews.Author: hazzy1008
Reviews.Content: Could not fault the hotel however the location was not very convenient. It was a 20 minute walk to the nearest attractions and to the tourist (red and blue) bus routes.

Reviews.Title: “Clean central & good value”
Reviews.Author: dw842
Reviews.Content: Rooms comfortable, Impeccably clean (and I'm picky!). Only 2 mins walk from the North bus station, and 5 mins from the nearest metro (Arc de Triomf) . Friendly multilingual staff. Free internet access. Small downside: No evening meals (but who wants to eat in the hotel anyway, with that many restaurants about ), and a 15 minute stroll from the centre of things (Placa de Catalunya) . Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Sunshine Lovers”
Reviews.Author: euphrates78
Reviews.Content: Everything was OK for a 3 star hotel except the fact that we were not able to see any single ray of sunshine in our room. I felt depressed a little bit... Free minibar and internet were appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, just a little far out.”
Reviews.Author: Golden_Vision
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from a 3 night/2 day long weekend and stayed at the Confortel Auditori. It's a great hotel, very modern, very clean and has a free mini bar with fruit juice, water, coke and beer which is replenished everyday. The pool is admitedly very small but we didn't plan to use it so it didn't matter to us. The hotel is based in a residential area but we quite liked being able to escape the hustle and bustle at the end of the day. La Ramblas was in walking distance but probably would have taken between 25-35 minutes depending on how fast you wanted to walk. For us, having been on our feet exploring all day, we got a taxi to take us there in the evenings. On average it cost about 5 or 6 euros which we didn't mind paying. We did take a leisurely stroll to La Sagrada on the Sunday and that only took about half an hour. We didn't bother eating at any of the restaurants close by, we preferred to be in the busier areas. We stayed room only but did pay the 13 euros each to have breakfast on our last day. It was a buffet breakfast with fresh fruit, salamis, cheese, breads, cereals etc. It was mostly cold food although you could do your own toast, as you usually can at a hotel breakfast. My only complaint (and it is a little one) is that it would have been nice to have something hot on there. Not a major moan. If you do stay in Barcelona, make sure you get down to the port areas as well as the usual tourist areas. Barceloneta is also lovely.

Reviews.Title: “above average 3 *”
Reviews.Author: mcfc20
Reviews.Content: Taxi to the hotel from the airport about 30 euros Check in was smooth and rooms clean and comfortable location was in a quiet area but 5 mins walk from the arc de triumph metro station which gives you easy and cheap access to most of the city The hotel is quite new which is why its above average but it definately is a 3 star,there is no bar ,the restaurant times are limited,no tea and coffee making facilities and a very small pool/sun lounging area Thoroughly enjoyed Barcelona...but possibly the most expensive city I have visited probably down to the pound/ euro rate at the time.. 1x lager and a baileys on the ramblas 15 euros (£12) slightly cheaper around port olympic and elsewhere but not much and even round the hotel it was 7 euros for a couple of drinks Did all the usual tourist sites ,beach seemed to be clean,but didnt really use it Nou camp was very good(14 euros) as well as all the Gaudi sites After reading the trouble about pickpockets I was quite wary when i arrived but need not have worried...didnt see any trouble at all in the 5 days i was there ,There a few beggars around and around midday we saw some bloke walking down the ramblas totally naked but that was all so to sum up great city ...average hotel

Reviews.Title: “Uneven Experience”
Reviews.Author: ChiMagMile
Reviews.Content: They had a decent exercise room, a decent breakfast (included in our package) a small rooftop pool, free internet and a great location, also free(!) minibar. The hotel was also very clean. The only problem was the service was very uneven. One dek staff person was professional, and even pleasant but not especially caring, although this may have been a language or cultural barrier between us, and one was consistently surly and even hostile in his demeanor. (Again, could have been cultural-linguistic issue-- I admit, I don´t speak Catellan and barely Spanish! ) The third, however, David, was especially wonderful. As we checked out there was a miscommunication between the cab driver and the desk--the driver thought we were going to the airport, and we weren´t. So all was quite good, except the service, which was a decidedy mixed bag. I would still recommend it--, maybe the surly guy will find work he likes better and won´t be there anymore.

Reviews.Title: “a little gem with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: jamoinoz
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good hotel under 100 euros a night in downtown barcelona this is it! A terrific location in what i would call a quiet local area, within a brisk 20 min walk to Plaza de Catalunya. The staff were extremely helpful with maps and information. The room was very modern with a nice big bath. Around the corner is a good cheap pizzeria if you find yourself hungry!

Reviews.Title: “Great Break”
Reviews.Author: WestMidlandsAnn
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day break at this hotel, have to say it is the best 3 star hotel we have ever stayed in, rooms were clean and mini bar was a great bonus, the staff were helpful and friendly. Weather was 30 degrees,Only downside was not many places to eat, the Italian on the corner opposite the hotel was awful, waitress was rude and abrupt and the food tastless would not recommend. The Oriential Restaurant opposite the bus station was nice and resonable around 8 euros for a 3 course meal. If you are arriving into Barcelona airport the bus will take you into Placa Catalunya for 4 euros we then caught a taxi to the hotel for 6 euros. Las Ramblas was expensive we ordered 2 cokes and paid 12 euros, there is a few Irish bars off Las Ramblas if you fancy a change from local beers! the walk into Las Ramblas was about 20 mins, we walked to the beach this was about 25 mins and Sagrada about 35 mins, decided not to get the tourist bus as we wanted to walk and see the sights. If you are visiting FCB Stadium then the number 54 bus near the hotel will take you there for 1.30 euros and drops you off right outside a nice little find!. Overall we really enjoyed our city break in Barcelona we travel often and normally don't go back to the same place twice but we will be returning next June and staying at the Confortel. Excellent!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: KatRay2012
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and the staff are friendly but there were a number of issues which made our stay quite disappoining. Firstly part of the reason we booked the hotel was due to the fact it had a pool. In reality the "pool" is a 2 metre by 2 metre square stuck in a tight corner on the 7th floor of the hotel which we refered to as "the cattle dip". There was no seating or loungers around the"pool" and only 5 or 6 sun loungers crushed into a tiny area just below and to the left of the "pool" area with two umbrellas which meant, due to the size of the space, that even if you were able to get a seat up there - which would mean queuing for the door to be unlocked at 9.30am, then quite often you could not actually get out of the sun once it was at a certain position in the sky. For a hotel which has a "pool" as one of it´s main selling points I´m not sure that the area actually provided to guests qualifies, especially given the number of hotel rooms and so guests to the actually facilities offered. The free mini bar also sounded great but realistically all it contains is a couple of small bottles of water, coca cola and some non-alcoholic beer. Once you take into account the fact that the pool and mini bar promise is not quite what it seems you are left feeling particularly peeved when the hotel staff tell you they do not have an iron or ironing board in the whole hotel and that you have to pay the extra to use the hotel laundry facilities. For us who were attending a wedding the hotel managed to fleece us out of just under 30 Euro simply to have a suit and shirt ironed! Some other more minor issues included the air con in the room being so weak that I hardly noticed it was on and spent most of our stay absolutey boiling, admitedly it works in the hotel foyer but not in the upstairs corridors or seemingly our room unfortunately. The restaurant is more like a canteen with the tables in the lobby area and the menu leaving a lot to be desired. This is not really a restaurant but more a cafeteria if they are being honest. The room is very minimalist, to the point that there is so little lighting I spent most of the time in my room feeling like a mole as I scratched around to try and find things in the dark. Finally the bathroom was so small and built in such a wierd shape that you had to close the door just to get to the toilet, only the door didn´t propery close. The shower screen also did not fit properly so with each shower the floor flooded meaning that any attempts to actually exit the tub became a game of "lets not break your neck" on the flooded tiled floor. All in all this hotel does not offer a very good deal unless you are happ poor value for your mony. From looking at other places during our stay I can honestly say we would not be staying with them in future and that your money could be much better spent elsewere and provide a much more pleasurable stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: alieninny
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Barcelona... stayed at Confortel Auditori for five nights. Room was exactly as described here very clean and with amenities of a 4 or 5 star at 3star prices. I had heard about the free minibar which was great but even better was the free wifi internet all over the hotel. The staff was courteous and friendly ... check took three mins and room was ready when we arrived the 2pm. They organised my taxi at 4am on the way back and pretty much took all instructions well and followed up on all things to the tee. Only downside i found it further from La Rambla etc than I thought it would be but that was bec I had not paid close attention to the location. All in all superb experience comparable in service and cleanliness to the 5star i stayed in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: eagleeye73
Reviews.Content: the location of the hotel is perfect 5 min walk from the bus staion,if you arrive at the bus station take exit 0ne via the lift ,walk straight ahead and the hotel is on the corner, we caught the bus from girona airport 21e return and it takes just over an hour. the hotel was really nice,nice and clean friendly staff if you arrive late they do a pizza delivery service,when your very tired its a welcome treat. i went with my friend we are both early 30`s and we felt really safe as long as you go with a bit of common sense you cant go wrong. a 5 min walk from the hotel brings you to the arc de triomf where there are loads of cafe bars,we spent most of the days just walking around no need for the metro ,from the hotel it takes around 45 to the port again loads of place to eat,20 min to the sagrada familia,25 min la rambla,by foot . the reason i liked the hotel was that is was near every thing but not in everything.the hotel had a pool ...well more jaccuzzi size ,but as we were out all day we didn`t use it. the tourist bus 21e for the day is a great way to get around the city ,guell park(which is free),the cable ride at monjuic is a fab way of seeing the city in all its splender and there is a great bar called bar miramar , views from the roof at catedral de barcelona are breathtaking. most places you visit cost from 5-10e. avoid eating on the la rambla very expensive,we walked down side streets and found some amazing tapas bars. overall barcelona is an amazing place and the hotel is a perfect base,avoid breakfast at 13e its not worth it,there are plenty of places near by to grab breakie.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: lbarlow
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! We stayed here prior to a cruise and love this hotel. The staff were amazing- we arrived at 8 am after a 9 hour flight and they got us a room right away. The location was great only one bus ride away from the heart of the city. The room was clean and comfortable. The free internet was a bonus. There were plenty of little cafe's right around the corner where we enjoyed breakfast as the hotel prices were a bit steep. The bus tours are WELL worth the money as they city is spread out and its about the only way to fit everything in- in such a short stay, All in all- would highly reccomend!

Reviews.Title: “Virtually faultless - a great find !”
Reviews.Author: Jo2477
Reviews.Content: A 5-night stay with my best friend sharing a twin room on the 2nd floor. The hotel was modern and very clean, the room a reasonable size, and the location welcomingly off the beaten tourist track but close to the metro and within easy adult walking distance of all the sights. The room had a welcome free minibar and air-con, and fantastically soundproof patio doors which were openable in the day. There was a splashpool and small sundeck on the roof. The buffet breakfasts were plentiful and amazing - open 7-10.30am and constantly refreshed even up to the last 10 minutes of the sitting. There were sufficient restaurants and supermarkets nearby without having to make a real effort to go out after a long day exploring, and reasonable prices because of the hotel's location. The only downside (and that was so tiny it didn't really bother us) was that the room didn't have tea or coffee making facilities, although you could have free coffee every morning between 5.30-7.00am if you were awake !! Would definitely recommend and return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, good position”
Reviews.Author: paulc051
Reviews.Content: Good, clean, modern hotel. Located about a five minute walk to the nearest metro station "arc de triumph" so you are able to tour the whole city easily. We purchased a ten trip ticket for 7 euros or you can do one for three days for 14 euros. Free minibar in the room comprises 2 still waters, 2 sparking waters, 2 orange juice, 2 coca cola and 2 beers. These are stocked up every morning when the room is cleaned. The room is modern and clean with a flat screen tv on the wall. Only a couple of english speaking channels though. Bathroom has a large shower and plenty of complementary toiletries. If you are wanting a full english breakfast then this is not the place for you. Cereals, toast, ham, cheese, croissants and a selection cakes. Juice and coffee is available. There are 2 free internet connections located in the lobby. Handy if you need and info or just want to keep in touch. There is a very small gym and an equally small pool on the roof, which is closed at this time of year. Warned about pickpockets but we did not have a problem. Took the tourist bus which costs 20 euros for the day and you can hop on and off as much as you like. You catch it at the top of Las Ramblas, which is within walking distance of the hotel. Overall very pleased with the hotel it is an excellent base for seeing Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Feenee
Reviews.Content: Just back (7hrs!) from Barcelona and a 3 night stay in Confortel Auditori. Well located hotel- 6 blocks from Sagrada Familia, 1 block (visible) from Coach station (drop off point from Gerona for Ryanair flights). Bit further to Rambla but hey, who's in a rush? We walked back at 11- midnight on all 3 nights, no problems, all the way from Catalunya Square. Hotel is very clean and modern. Free minibar (2xbeer, 2x water, 2x juice, 2x coke) very welcome as are free PC terminals in foyer. Breakfast way over the top at 16.5 Euro. They also serve a 3 course menu for 17 Euro each day but only between 1.30pm and 3.30pm (!?) There are very many supermarkets in the area, including Lidl, so you can get picnic stuff very easily. Breakfast is another matter as a simple croissant and coffee is about as much as we found. Rooms are large but dim! A central atruim does not let much light in and we were on the first floor. A missing bulb in the only lamp was replaced immediately I mentioned it. Not enough lighting elsewhere in the room. Bed excellent, lots of storage and a security safe. Bathrooms strange- well done but impractical with a double-sized shower tray and a powerful shower only half covered by a glass screen. Hence the room floods each time the shower is used as the water bounces off you and the walls... sink a little small but (only hotel in 30 years with THIS feature) a heated mirror! No steaming up mirrors! Directions- from the bus station head for platform 1 exit (NOT 10) and go straight over from the entrance doors. Cross 1 set of lights at the entrance to a pedestrian area on your right and the hotel is immediately in from of you on the next corenr. You can see it from the bus station if you know where to look.

Reviews.Title: “Great, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: El-Saato
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife spent the weekend at Confortel barcelona and we were quite scared as we didnt know what to expect (the hotel only opened 10 days before and we could find no reviews). Th hotel itself is fantastic. The building and room is of an extremely modern style, with great attention to detail. The staff were friendly and efficient, and we had a great view of the beach (which is only 10 mins walk away). The restaurant is also reasonably priced. The gym is small, yet great, and we loved the fact that we got a free mini-bar (includes 2 beers, 2 still and 2 sparkling water and 4 soft drinks)

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ernest7
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from three nights at the Confortel Auditori and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I can only concur with some of the previous reviews - the room was clean and the free minibar was a nice touch. The flat screen television only had a couple of English channels, BBC World was one of them. We didn't bother with the breakfast. It was a bit pricey and there are plenty of cafes around offering much better deals. There's not much to see close to the hotel but you're only five minutes walk to the metro station - Arc de Triomf and Monumental are the closest.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: kvesterb
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Confortel Auditori. The hotel was clean and nice, with a friendly staff. Nice room with a decent bed, clean bathroom and... free minibar! =) Also a flatscreen TV, but mostly spanish channels. A big plus was the free Internet in the hotel lobby, you also could access free WLAN. You also could have a breakfast for an additional fee of 16 €/person, which we found quite pricey. The hotel was located in a quiet area, near to a bus station and the metro stop Arc de Triumf. In our opinion the hotel was ok and well worth the money. You will have a pleasant stay at Hotel Confortel Auditori.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable and good location - would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: ocalllo
Reviews.Content: Getting a decent hotel in Barcelona within walking distance to the city is difficult but i would totally recommend this one. We flew direct into BCN and there is a bus transfer to the metro and then a change to get you to Arc De Triumph (sp?) Station. look for directions when you get off the train you want the Naples exit toward the bus station, from there it is a 4 mins walk. On arrival the receptionist was very pleasant and check in was very quick. I had requested a floor on the higher level but upon arrival we discovered we had been given a disabled room with a very small/low shower - (my husband is 6'2'). we rang reception and they swapped us to a room on the 2nd floor instead. The free mini bar is a great bonus and plenty of toiletries and a hair dryer as standard. It was about a 15mins pleasant walk into town, leaving you at the top of La Ramba. Or 2/3 metro stops. We partied hard so did not use any of the facilities, eat or drink in the hotel but it did look all very welcoming and clean. i would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Confortel Auditori”
Reviews.Author: matyovis
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Feels like business hotel with some luxuries: free mini bar, free internet, free gym. The location is very good, 5 min from metro, 15 min from city center. Very clean, nice design, good stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah1979London
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. It is very clean, modern and the free mini bar is a nice touch. Only disappointing thing was that the bar shut at 8.30pm but this did not bother us too much as we went out each night. Be sure to get a card off the reception as when we were getting taxis they were getting a bit confused as to our location because it is a one way road. If you show them your card you will be fine. Would stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “So pleased to have stayed here”
Reviews.Author: wildsurfdude
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a three day trip to Barcelona, and stayed at this great hotel. Chose the Auditori for it's location near the main bus station, and it's literally 300 yds from it! Had booked a twin room for myself and a friend, but on arrival was told they only had a double room. Without me causing a fuss, they decided to give us two rooms, what great service! This also meant two free mini-bars, bonus! The rooms are modern and very clean, with nice bathrooms and the usual array of gels and soaps etc. You also have the facility of free internet access via their own on site p.c's, very handy. The hotel has a great buffet breakfast 15 euro extra, but nice if you need filing up. It is a great base for everything in the City, has some fairly cheap spanish bars located nearby, the Ramblas is a 15 min walk, Sagrada Familia 15 mins to the North, 10 euro taxi ride to the Nou Camp. Overall, this was my third visit to the City and by far and away the best hotel i've stayed in, especially for the price and location. Would highly recommend, and look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, bad location”
Reviews.Author: Maydane
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in this newly renovated hotel. The rooms are mediumsize, but very fresh and clean, decent bathtubs, and bedsize. They also have flatscreen but only two english channels, fortunately the city has alot to offer so it doesn't matter. The hotel is far from the center, but metro is 500 meters away. The breakfast is really awful and overpriced. Stay away for the love of god, but across the street is a bakery. Use that instead. They give away free bottles of water, which is a nice little treat. They also have a small gym in the basement, but useable. would I stay again, no, I would pick something more in the centre, but I have no complaints, beside location and breakfast. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay here!”
Reviews.Author: terracotta_army
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a long weekend from Barcelona where we stayed at the Auditori based on reviews on Tripadvisor. Very convenient for those arriving at Barcelona's north bus station (from Girona airport) - only 3 minutes walk away! We arrived at 11 in the morning and dropped in to see whether we could leave our bags there until check-in at 1pm. However, they checked us in straight away whcih was really good of them! Check-in was quick and efficient. Was great to be able to leave our bags in our room and also to grab a drink from the free minibar. Nice selection - 2 cokes, 2 fruit juices, 2 still and 2 fizzy waters and 2 beers! As some have commented, it's about a 15-20 min walk to Placa La Catalunya but the Arc De Triomf metro station is only 5 minutes walk away and we used the metro quite a few times. Tip - it may pay you to buy a T10 card if you only use the metro a few times. We nearly bought the 3 day travel card at 14.30 euros each (there were 2 of us) but in the end bought 2 T10 cards which gave us 20 journeys. Note - you can also use one T10 card between a group of us. Our highlights were La Pedrera, Parc Guell and the cable car at Montjuic. After several tired days walking around, it was always nice to come back to the comfortable Auditori. Would probably stay there again if we ever returned to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “It really is a perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: vallico2008
Reviews.Content: Perfectly placed within walking distance of the bus station, the drop off point for Ryanair flights. A quiet street ( and a room at the back is even quieter so ask for one). Modern, minimalist and very smart in style. Extremely clean and well kept. The room was spacious and comfy and the bathroom was excellent. No noise at all from other guests. Reception and other staff courteous and friendly. This hotel is non smoking in the public areas which was wonderful.We didn't eat there as it's nice to stroll to a cafe for breakfast. Free wifi was great, so handy and you can access the interent in the lobby for free as well. Nearby there are some good restaurants but you do have to walk a bit, excellent Italian up by the Sagrada Familia. I liked the Chinese place by the bus station. The nearby supermarket sells everything you could want. We shall return to this super hotel. Reasonable prices for a city stay as well.

Reviews.Title: “Want lower price?Great staff, great location, free mini bar”
Reviews.Author: arj7277
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Barcelona, Spain was unbelievable. The hotel rooms were clean, contemporary and nothing beats a free mini bar after hours of walking around the eloquent city. The staff were very friendly and helped us with whatever we needed. The hotel is close to everything, bus, metro, the famous park, etc.. and we walked to the Ramblas quite often. The area wasn't "touristy" so the prices were not "raised" and you can pretty much get a great meal/drinks for under 20.00euro/two people. There is great coffee shop across the street frequented by locals in the area where you can get fantastic coffee and a muffin for under 3 euro to start your day. There is also a supermarket a block behind the hotel if you are in a budget. It's the "in" thing in the area to buy a bottle of wine, and walk around the park and hang out the locals. If you want better rates, book through BARCELONA TOURISM BOARD WEBSITE. (make your fingers google;o)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Not so good location”
Reviews.Author: spaintripToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Confortel Auditori for 3 night in January. The hotel in it's self is fine. The front desk staff were very good and helpful. The room was clean and well appointed. My husband appreciated the free internet, and they also stock the mini bar with free beverages which was a very nice touch. The most unfortunate thing is the location. It's not in a very great area, we often took cabs in the evening. It's also a half hour walk to the centre. We also stayed at the Vincci Arena when we first arrived in Barcelona, and if I were to go back I would Chose the Vincci ove the Confortel. If you look up the Vincci review, I have given a review of it and also a few tips about the area and restaurants etc. Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: patatas
