Reviews.Content: Very nice modern hotel with free wireless network. Only negative aspect is that the location is maybe not the best of Barcelona, although it is reasonably close to placa catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves it's high rating”
Reviews.Author: Sarah63
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel from Trip Advisor after reading excellent reviews. What a fantastic place to stay! There really is nothing to be gained from looking at photos posted by visitors because the hotel's own photos are exactly as the place looks. Some would say that the location is a little far out of the centre but we walked everywhere with no bother. The view from the rooftop pool is terrific - worth going up there to see the gardens of the penthouse apartments surrounding the hotel. We never ate at the hotel but there is great little bar just opposite (The Olive Tree, I believe).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Korey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough! Based on the reviews I had read, I expected a great stay at this hotel, and I was not disappointed at all. In fact, this hotel exceeded my expectations. The room is spacious - certainly up to American standards - and clean. We have travelled over Europe and this hotel offers among the best accommodations we have experienced. The location is perfect for those who enjoy a good night's sleep - in a quiet neighborhood within Barcelona's Eixample district. The nearest metro stop is roughly two blocks away, and is on the same line as Placa Catalunya, the city's transit hub. Upon checking out, we left our bags with the front desk staff for about 8 hours while we went sightseeing before our flight out. There was no need for concern, as the staff did a great job protecting our luggage, for which we are very appreciative! The best perk was the FREE minibar, which was refilled each day! All we can say is that we will definitely be returning to Barcelona and will without a doubt be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Base”
Reviews.Author: Whitey30
Reviews.Content: Date: 13-16 Nov 07 Reviewer; Retired couple in our 60s We found the hotel from reviews on Trip Advisor which proved to be generally in line with our findings and an excellent choice. The hotel is new, of a good 3* superior standard and good value for money. Rooms are spotlessly clean, serviced to a high standard daily with plenty of space, a good double bed and excellent ensuit facilities. Staff are friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast option is well worth taking. No one seemed to eat dinner in the hotel - the restaurant one block south (facing Bacelona Nord Station) is good if you eat in the locality. Our recommendations for an excellent 3 day sightseeing break in Barcelona is to buy day passes (1,2 or 3) on the Metro and Bus Turistic. From the Hotel it is a 3 minute walk to the Napols Street entrance of the Arc de Triomf Metro station and then only 2 stops on the metro to Placa Catalunya from where you can walk the city or catch the Bus turistic. On return, look for the Napols exit when you get off the Metro as it is nearer to the hotel. Overall this Hotel is quiet, comfortable and good value. Barcelona is a wonderful city for a break.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: amosha
Reviews.Content: In a residential neighborhood, close to all Barcelona attractions, the Confortel offers excellent services, spacious rooms, up-to-date decor and state of the art technology, all at a very reasonable price. We stayed at the Confortel as part of our vacation, but this would be a very pleasant choice for business travelers as the hotel pays special attention to their needs. The staff was friendly, breakfast was great and the free mini-bar is a nice touch. All in all one of my best experiences in a hotel anywhere in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant and enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: Cymrobach
Reviews.Content: A group of sixteen of us spent five nights at this hotel at the end of October 2007 and I think that we were all well pleased with the experience. A few of our number had the ocassional breakfast in the hotel and found the food plentiful and of good quality but most of us gave it a miss because it added significantly to the cost. Alternative breakfast - On coming out of the hotel turn right and walk up to the next junction - then take the first left and continue down that road for approx 600-800m, towards the city centre, crossing a few crossroads, until you see a bar / cafe called Bar Fausto - they do a good English breakfast for 7.5 E or a continental for 5 E. The hotel staff were very pleasant, helpful and English speaking. Freebies such as the mini-bar, free mineral water (available in upper foyer) and internet access were well worth having. The bedrooms were very clean and comfortable, although those facing inwards were perhaps, less appealing. The security safe in each bedroom were also useful. The hotel is well situated, in a realtively quiet street but within walking distance (15 mins) of the city centre. One minor disadvantage is the lack of restaurants, as opposed to bar / cafes, within a mile of the hotel - we found ouselves having to wander to the city cntre most evenings. All in all, a very pleasant stay and I'm sure that all sixteen of us would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but misses on the 'little things'...”
Reviews.Author: Jacobus2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 10-day trip to Spain which included 3 nights in this hotel. It was by far the most expensive of the 4 hotels we visited, but we thought it would be nice to splurge on our last stay. Overall the Confortel Auditori was about what I expected - very modern (appropriate, I thought, for the city of the "modernistas"); well-located *if* you are willing to use the fantastic Barcelona metro system (which I highly recommend); sparkly clean; loaded with features (free Internet PCs, though often unavailable, free mini-bar). However... I am only giving this hotel 3 stars because for a relatively expensive hotel it had numerous little flaws that marred the experience. Right off the bat our room request was screwed up - we were very clear that we needed 2 beds (it was printed on our confirmation) but our room had only 1 double. It required a most unpleasant scene at the desk, and threats to leave before they rectified this (their first 5 responses were simply "sorry, nothing we can do" - wrong answer!) The flaws, mostly minor, continued... Though the weather was generally cool the hotel's interior was quite warm where not air-conditioned, even at night. This meant that we either had to use the AC (which often triggers my wife's allergies) or keep the window open. Thankfully, there was a window that opened onto the hotel's interior, but you simply couldn't both have the window open and use the privacy curtains (which were necessary in this case). Just one of several little design flaws. Here's another one: This was the only hotel I can ever recall where it was impossible to control the two reading lights separately - they were either both on or both off. Breakfast: Skip it. For 13 Euros (almost triple any other hotel on our trip) you could do much better anywhere else. They couldn't even provide a proper hard-boiled egg - apparently they didn't know that a boiled egg must be rinsed in cold water to allow easy peeling. Honestly, for 13 Euros... Again, symptomatic of a place that splurges on some things but screws up on the details.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Escape-reality
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel with friends. Our fourth visit to Barcelona in as many years but their first. Nice modern hotel with excellent housekeeping standards. Inward facing rooms not very big but perfectly acceptable. Not all rooms have bath with shower. Friends had breakfast every day and were very pleased. We are not big on breakfast and had coffee and pastry near the entrance to the metro. Local area is well worth taking the time to explore on foot. Arc de Triomph is the start of a pleasant walk to the marina. Sagrada Familia also an easy walk. This was the furthest we have stayed from the centre but very easy links via metro and taxi fare only about 5euro from Ramblas. Eating out at lunchtime try the stalls at the back of the market on Rambla. Best value in town but have to jostle for places with the locals. Hotel staff very helpful with directions and have some good complimentary city maps. Internet access in lobby on hotel computers was a big plus for us. No need to take laptop for a change! All round a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Free Mini Bar!”
Reviews.Author: Sul72
Reviews.Content: The Confortel Auditori is a great modern and clean hotel, it is idealy situated with a 5 min walk to the nearest metro station or a 10 min walk to La Ramblas. We had a great room very clean and tidy with a modern feel, free minibar that was refilled daily. There is a free gym open 24/7 and there is a small but very refreshing pool on the roof with a sun deck. The breakfast is very generous with a wide veriety of good fresh food. It was our first visit to Barcelona we loved the city and the hotel was the cherry on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kate191
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean hotel with simple but modern design. The hotel is very close to the metro station, so i can's understand why some people were complaning about the distance to the metro. It is literally 5 minutes! Breakfast was above the average with hot sandwiches and plenty of fresh fruits. Cant complain about a single thing!

Reviews.Title: “The Confortel Auditori is a hip place to stay”
Reviews.Author: brown_suga_traveler
Reviews.Content: The Confortel Auditori was very hip and confortable, not to mention cheap. I traveled with a friend to Barcelona on May 26, 2007, and stayed there for about 5 days. Ironically, me and a friend of mine found out about this hotel through another member here on Trip Advisor. We are so glad we took their advice. Although originally we were bummed we couldn't find a decent place within Placa de Cataluna (the main city square), we were glad we chose the Confortel because at night time it was secure, quiet, and clean. The hotel was very modern and hip for young travelers, and the staff members were very plesant, helpful and accomodating. Not to mention we were just close enough to the city with a 5 minute Metro ride. We couldn't have asked for a better place to stay. The only down side to the trip is that the hotel did not provide irons, therefore we could not iron our clothes. And they also do not provide washcloths.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: IMD-Mid-Wales
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week in early September 2007 on our honeymoon. We'd booked it on the strength of the reviews on this site and were really pleased. The hotel was spotlessly clean and the staff on the front desk spoke good english and were more than helpful. Our room (607) was spacious and looked out over the street. There were a pair of doors which opened out looking over the street, meaning that you could get some fresh air and take in the outside atmosphere while still lying on your bed. The double bed was really comfortable and the bathroom was lovely with a very powerful shower and hot bath. Oh, and we mustn't forget to mention the free minibar. It does exactly what it says on the tin, there was a range of soft drinks and beer freshly topped up every day and we never had to pay a penny for any of them. The location was good, with a metro station virtually at the end of the block. There was also an excellent chinese restaurant within 100m of the front door. Infact, it was so good that we went there two nights in a row. Overall we had a very enjoyable time and wouldn't hesitate to recomend this hotel to anyone in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nermaliods
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights, in a double room thought it was great. Situauted minutes from Arc de Triomf metro station, the Confortel Auditori is in the centre of Barcelona but far enough away from the hustle and bustle to ensure you don't enounter street salesmen or thousands of other tourists when you step out of the door. The room was clean, functional and smartly decorated, we had free use of a minibar and the usual international hotel cable tv on a flat screen at the end of the bed. The bathroom was great with a powerful shower and mirrors that didn't steam up! Staff where friendly and helpful if a little overworked. There were two PC's in the lobby that could be used by residents to surf the web. I'd reccommend this hotel to anyone on a modest budget who wants to stay somewhere smart and functional.

Reviews.Title: “Convinient location friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: RY28
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located to explore Barcelona. Just outside the busy central areas and 5 minutes walk to the tube station (5 -10 minutes jorney into town) or 20 minutes walk to the main square (Placa Catalania) for the tourist bus and La Rambla. 15 minutes walk to the sea front and even less to the Citadella park. The staff were friendly and efficient and happy to help with directions. Unusually, the mini bar was complimentary and so was the internet access. For those with no laptops, there are 2 computers connected to the internet at reception (free). There were 2 supermarkets right next to the hotel. Hotel has a swimming pool with some deck chairs on the roof terrace and although tiny (about 5x 3m) and smelling of medicines (I guess it's the Spanich equivalient of chlorium) -still quite nice for dipping in on a hot day. Room was sufficient size and clean but the decor was slightly greyish. Nice bathroom. Aircon worked but was quite noisy so we switched it off at night. One problem for late sleepers would be noise in the corridor, it felt like there was no noise insulation whatsoever. Overall an enjoyable stay. Good 3* place. Maybe a bit on the expensive side (we paid about GBP70 per night). I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent service and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Losviages
Reviews.Content: Hotel Confortel Auditori is situated slightly aside from the main streets and center of the city, but especially if you know your way around in BCN, the location is good. Metro stop is nearby and you could basically walk to Placa Catalunia too. Hotel is neat, quiet and rather stylish. Rooms are comfortable and furbished in Scandinavian style. The customer service at the lobby was excellent and staff spoke fluent English. Free WLAN is available throughout the hotel and you can also use the public computers at the lobby. The swimming pool is small, but offers nevertheless a chance to refreshen after a long day at the city or in the morning. The free minibar was a nice surprise too, especially since it was refilled everyday! We were more than pleased with our experience and can warmly recommend this hotel to other travellers as well.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: tajabone2003
Reviews.Content: This hotel seemed to me overrated in comparison to many other hotels I have been. For a superior three star I do not expect not to have an iron and a board available for self-service (not in the room, but at least in the building). The answer to my request was that there is a price list in the room. Sure, this means that you may give your shirt or whatever to iron for at least 6 euro per piece during certain hours. How convenient...also, the free minibar is a marketing trick, do not expect normal minibar beverages, the only "alcoholic" drink being light beer. Also, the room I got was an uncomfortable corner room (maybe this is what internet bookers get). Next time I will use a different hotel in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: subbyc
Reviews.Content: Thanks, Tripadvisor, turned out to be a great hotel - we got a very spacious room, it was quiet, well appointed and lived up to all expectations. The staff were welcoming, house-keeping was excellent, the minibar was re-stocked daily and the toiletries provided were almost all you needed....maybe a conditioner with the shampoo would have been good, but that´s just nitpicking. The location is handy, maybe just a bit too much if you can´t walk, or don´t like to, to the major attractions. We found it ideally located since it was quiet at night and made for a good night´s sleep after the day´s hectic schedule. Didn´t eat at the restaurant, so can´t comment on that, nor did we swim...it´s a bit tiny to be really called a swimming pool, but we didn´t come to Barcelona to swim in the hotel pool. All in all, a great place to stay, nicely priced and great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “design hotel at a very good price”
Reviews.Author: steukerb
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights in Confortel Auditori in Barcelona and found this hotel an amazing good price/performance: modern design hotel with small but confortable rooms, free minibar and internet, small swimming pool on the roof, good breakfast (not sensational but a buffet with a good choice for everyone) (breakfast was included in price) and nice welcoming hotel people - not in the heart of the city but pretty close to all sightseeing spots by walking or closeby metro - I would certainly come back a next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dunkeld10
Reviews.Content: After reading many hotel reviews, we decided to stay at the Confortel Auditor and we were not disappointed. The hotel is in an ideal location for transport links, only 2/3mns walk from the Arc De Triomf Metro Station (use the Naples exit as closer to the hotel the the others) and the Nord Bus Station, good for airport transfers. Even being close to the transport links, the hotel was in a quiet residential street, nice to come back to after a busy day. The room was very comfortable, modern with plasma tv screen and complimentary mini-bar. Free internet access was available in the hotel lobby, aswell as fitness room and small pool on the rooftop. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, used the bakers across the street, lovely. A 15/20 mns walk takes you to the busy Las Ramblas area. We found it quite nice to walk back to the hotel and leave the buzz of Las Ramblas behind. If you're too tired to walk, use the Metro. Overall, we had a lovely time in Barcelona, staying in a comforable and clean, modern hotel that we would certainly use again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: glengirlBelfast
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Confortel Auditori...i can only sing its praises. I found the hotel by doing some online research and then visited Trip Advisor to hear some reviews... i was not disappointed! Location is great, metro station a stone throw from the hotel, providing accessibility to all the major attractions. The hotel is based in a quiet less commercial/tourist area (hence the great value for money). The hotel room was top class with air conditioning, free mini bar and well stocked bathroom. I would also recommend the bakery across the road from the hotel as well as an excellent chinese restaurant a short distance away!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel short stroll from tourist tat area....”
Reviews.Author: Viz66
Reviews.Content: Confortel Auditori is a 10-15 minute stroll from the centre of Barcelona in a clearly affluent residential street near a main line railway station. If you prefer to stay amongst the tat and pickpockets of Las Ramblas, then it won't be for you. If however, like me, you prefer a air-conditioned spotlessly clean minimalist room with a plasma TV and excellent facilities (small gym, pool, etc) at a affordable price then you can't go wrong with this place. This hotel is about a year old and currently (unbelievably) a 3 star. Given time and inspection it will be a 4 star. Anyone who thought the rooms were small at this hotel clearly aren't used to big city life, and Barcelona is a big city just like London Paris or New York. The rooms were actually neither big or small, but of a comfortable size for two people. And your mini bar will be stocked with free beer, fruit juice and coke every day, what more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in BCN”
Reviews.Author: paris1949
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Auditori with friends. Our room was clean, quiet, comfortable and well equipped. Hotel staff were pleasant and helpful, and the free computer access in the lobby is an added bonus. Our friends tried the 13 Euro buffet breakfast and gave it just a "so so" rating for the price. There are lots of patisseries and cafe's nearby to try for an inexpensive breakfast. It is about a 10 min. hike to the nearest metro station (Arc de Triomf) and about a 15 min. walk to Placa de Catalunya. All in all we had a great stay and can definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Close to Metro”
Reviews.Author: emccic
Reviews.Content: We recently spent one night at the Confortel and it was great. We arrived early before check in and they were able to hold our bags for us. We stayed for one night after debarking a cruise ship. Taxi to the hotel from the port was around 15 euros. La Sagrada Familia was a 10 minute walk away. Reception staff pointed us in the right direction. Found the staff to be helpful and friendly. They seemed to all speak some English, although we are also Spanish speaking and found it easiest to communicate in Spanish. The metro station was less than a 5 minute walk away. The room was clean, quiet and had great air conditioning. Taxi to the airport cost around 25 euros and took approx. 30 minutes. We were there on a Sunday so most things in the neighborhood of the hotel were closed. But again, it's a quick walk to the metro. Overall a great hotel in a good location. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Tourist Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wafto
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here last week and can only back up all the other reviews that praised it highly. Modern, clean building, small but well furnished rooms, friendly staff and excellent breakfast. Good location, only 3 minutes walk from the Metro or 25-30 minutes walk to the main square, highly recomended and will stay here when we next come to Barcelona.
